6679.post_title: Roggermaier Takes First European Delivery Of Snorkel’s New Electric Scissor Lifts
6679.post_content:
Founded in 1983, Roggermaier is a family-owned enterprise which ranks among the biggest rental companies in Germany today with over 1,400 machines in its fleet and 130 employees. They serve a diverse base of clients, in sectors ranging from construction, energy, automotive, telecommunications, the film industry as well as municipalities and trade shows.

Snorkel delivered the first of the new scissor lifts earlier this month, and provided detailed technical training to Roggermaier’s service team to ensure a smooth transition into their fleet.

Mr. Roggermaier said, “We are pleased to be the first customer of the new Snorkel scissor lifts in Europe.  We have always considered ourselves as a provider of cutting-edge equipment, and these machines perfectly reflect our philosophy. I was really impressed by Snorkel’s new design approach at The Rental Show which clearly benefits from the knowledge and experience of Mr. Ahern.”

“The new lifts have many features which will benefit my rental business, and this has been reinforced by our service engineers who are very impressed with the machines, especially the robust build and high quality components. They expect them to be very reliable in the field and commented that the innovative construction type will also offer numerous advantages in the area of service and support.”    

Snorkel launched its new family of electric scissor lifts at this year’s The Rental Show, and displayed the first CE-approved models for Europe at Vertikal Days last month.  The new family includes four models, ranging from the S3219E which delivers 5.79m of platform height from a 0.81m wide chassis, to the S4732E which delivers 9.75m of platform height from a 1.19m wide chassis. Designed to perform in tough environments and to handle the demands of the rental industry, these lifts are packed with innovative features that lower total ownership costs.

Enrique Garcia Delgado, European Regional Sales Manager for Snorkel was present for the handover of the lifts to Mr. Roggermaier.  He commented, “We are thrilled to be delivering the first of our new electric scissor lifts to Roggermaier GmbH, which is a highly regarded rental company throughout Southern Germany and beyond.  We are confident that our new lifts will be a great addition to their fleet.”

For more information about Roggermaier GmbH, please visit  http://www.roggermaier.de. For more information regarding Snorkel, please visit www.snorkellifts.com.

6688.post_title: Snorkel Products To Be Sold & Serviced In Germany By “Ahern Deutschland”
6688.post_content:
COLOGNE, GERMANY (July 22nd, 2015) – Snorkel, the global manufacturer of aerial work platforms, is pleased to announce that its products will be sold and serviced by Ahern Deutschland, the new direct sales and service operation in Germany and Austria.  

The new entity, Ahern Deutschland GmbH, is part of the Ahern International division, which also includes Ahern Australia, Ahern Japan and Ahern Canada.  The Ahern International operations are solely focused on regional equipment distribution, supporting customers in the rental industry and end user sectors, and do not offer any equipment rental services.  Ahern Deutschland will provide nationwide sales and service for Snorkel aerial work platforms and Xtreme Manufacturing telehandlers.

Ahern Deutschland will be based between Cologne and Frankfurt within the Westerwald-Rhein/Sieg area of Germany, where the company plans to open an 18,000sqm (190,000sq. ft.) facility later this year.  The facility will incorporate a showroom, office and training space, a fully-equipped workshop, a spare parts warehouse, and a yard for stock machines.

Ahern Deutschland will be led by Bernhard Kahn who joins as General Manager.  Bernhard has over 20 years of experience in the aerial lift industry, starting his career as an independent service technician in the 1990’s.  Following training to become an electrical engineering technician and his achievement of a Master Craftsman’s Diploma, he moved into the distribution of aerial work platforms in 1997 and joined Genie in 2000, where he later successfully led the company’s sales operations in German-speaking countries.

Bernhard is responsible for developing sales of Snorkel and Xtreme equipment into the German and Austrian markets, through the Ahern Deutschland entity, which will initially employ 8 staff. 

To effectively support the customer base, Ahern Deutschland will hold a large stock of machines and spare parts at its facility, which will be available to customers in the German mainland and surrounding regions, ensuring fast delivery. This will be backed by a network of mobile service engineers providing nationwide coverage for technical support, troubleshooting, and product training.

Ahern Deutschland will be officially launched at Platformers’ Days, which takes place in Hohenroda, Germany on 11th & 12th September 2015.

Don Ahern, owner of Ahern Deutschland GmbH said “The German equipment market is significant both in terms of units and value, but also in terms of geography.  To effectively support a market of this size requires investment in a direct operation.  Ahern Deutschland was the natural next step for us as we grow our business, and we are looking forward to developing relationships with customers across Germany.  Our new facility is also well placed to better support our existing distributors and customers across Southern and Eastern Europe with the supply of equipment and spare parts.”

Bernhard Kahn added, “I have rarely experienced such a motivated team, but under Don Ahern’s lead and ownership, it feels like Snorkel and Xtreme are experiencing a veritable second spring. I am grateful and excited to be appointed as General Manager of Ahern Deutschland.  My goal is to provide our customers with high quality products, backed with the best customer service and fast after-sales support.”

Ahern Deutschland will handle all Snorkel sales in Germany and Austria, supported by existing Snorkel distribution partners and resellers in the region as appropriate.

Ahern Deutschland can be contacted on +49 2682 96766-8 or via e-mail at info@aherndeutschland.de. A website is currently under development at www.aherndeutschland.de.

6695.post_title: Ahern Deutschland Officially Launches At Platformers’ Days 2015
6695.post_content:
Hohenroda, Germany (11th September 2015) The opening of Platformers’ Days 2015 today marks the official launch of Ahern Deutschland GmbH – the new direct sales and service entity for Snorkel aerial work platforms and Xtreme Manufacturing telehandlers in Germany & Austria.

Part of the Ahern International division, which is owned by Don Ahern, the new operation provides nationwide sales, service and parts, but does not offer equipment rental. Led by General Manager, Bernhard Kahn, the Ahern Deutschland team provides localized, German language customer service, sales, parts and product support to customers in the rental industry and end user sectors. 

Following the initial announcement in July, Ahern Deutschland is pleased to confirm that they have secured an 18,500sqm (200,000 sq. ft.) site based in Weyerbusch, Western Germany, which is on the outskirts of the Westerwald and Rhein-Sieg area, conveniently located between Cologne and Frankfurt.  The site includes a 3,500sqm (38,000 sq. ft.) main building, as well as 15,000sqm (162,000 sq. ft.) of outdoor yard and logistics space.  The facility is currently under refurbishment, with the first phases due for completion in October 2015.

The facility will hold a large stock of Snorkel and Xtreme equipment, as well as spare parts, ensuring fast availability for German customers.  It will also be home to a training school, showroom, and a substantial workshop with paint capabilities.

Ahern Deutschland today also launches their new German-language website at www.aherndeutschland.de.  Visitors to the website will be able to learn more about Ahern Deutschland’s services, as well as browse full specifications for all Snorkel and Xtreme products.  Customers can request quotations directly through the site, and can also download technical manuals and service bulletins free of charge. 

Visitors to Platformers’ Days can find our more about Ahern Deutschland on their stand, as well being able to enjoy some USA-style hospitality, including traditional American-style hotdogs.  The Ahern Deutschland stand is also the launch pad for new Snorkel products, including the German debut of the new electric slab scissor range, and the global introduction of the upgraded Snorkel A38E electric articulated boom lift, and the Snorkel S3370RT compact rough terrain scissor lift.

Ahern Deutschland can be contacted on +49 2686 98717 -38 or via email to info@aherndeutschland.de.  Visit the new Ahern Deutschland website at www.aherndeutschland.de.

6704.post_title: German-Debut For New Snorkel Electric Scissor Lifts At Platformers’ Days
6704.post_content:
Hohenroda, Germany (11th September 2015)  Snorkel debuts their new electric slab scissor line to the German market at Platformers’ Days, which opens today. 

The new lifts, which were shown at The Rental Show in New Orleans in February, and in the UK at Vertikal Days in May, now make their first-appearance in Germany on the Ahern Deutschland stand at the Hohenroda-based event. 

The new hydraulic drive family includes four models: S3219E, S3226E, S4726E, and S4732E.   The S3219E provides 5.79m of platform height from a 0.81m wide chassis and can lift 250kg, while the taller S3226E delivers 7.9m of platform height can also lift 250kg.  The 1.2m wide S4726E can lift 454kg to 7.9m, and the S4732E can lift 350kg to 9.8m.  Non-marking tyres and saloon-style entry gates are fitted as standard. 

Designed to handle the tough conditions of the rental industry, these lifts are packed with innovative features which benefit both the rental company and the operator.  The new dual shear design scissor stack features oversized pins, which are over 80% stronger than the industry standard, to increase stack rigidity and increase the life of the machine. 

The platform is made from 2.7mm (12 gauge) diamond plate, eliminating the need for grip tape.  All models feature Snorkel’s new extension deck design which utilizes telescopic rails to maximize the floorspace of the platform, whether stowed or extended.  The extension decks have also been increased to provide additional outreach and a larger working platform.  The S3219E & S3226E features an industry-leading 0.91m extension deck, while the larger S4726E & S4732E have a 1.21m deck extension.

Upper controls are hard mounted to reduce loss and theft and the lower controls are positioned in the rear of the chassis, allowing easy access when machines are parked side-by-side.  A pendant control panel for loading is fitted to the external toeboard of the machine, allowing the operator to ‘walk’ the machine onto a truck, from a safe distance, without needing to be inside the platform.

With a focus on simplicity and durability, the lifts have a gravity-actuated, over-center active pothole protection system that does not rely on springs or hydraulics.  The kingpins have been enhanced by a factor of six to eliminate breakage, especially from forklifts when moving the machines.  The S3219E and S3226E both have 75mm kingpins and the S4726E and S4732E both have 100mm kingpins.  All new Snorkel slab scissor lifts have a 90° steering design.

Efficient maintenance is an important factor for customers, and the Snorkel scissor lifts feature an ‘inside-out’ tray design which makes light work of servicing the equipment.  All hydraulic and electrical components are able to rotate outside of the machine chassis for easy access.  With

two smaller side doors on each side of the lift instead of the traditional single large door, the operator is able to gain access to the machine components even when parked close to a wall or obstacle as only 0.46m of clearance is required.  The smaller door trays also carry less weight, meaning less strain on the door hinges.

The front side trays both contain batteries, which improve the overall machine balance.  The two rear side trays contain the hydraulic valve and hydraulic power unit.  There is a rear tray containing all electronics including the charger, controller, and contactors.  The tray is housed in heavy-duty 6mm (¼”) steel which provides additional protection to the electrical components and wiring.

The chassis features a solid plate underneath it to protect the undercarriage and a flat top to ensure that any debris falls onto the ground during power washing and does not remain within the machine.  Large, easily accessible tie down points are provided and a heavy-duty step is built into the chassis, enabling the use of a chain across it for tie down.

With 25% gradeability and a long duty cycle per charge, the new Snorkel series of electric slab scissor lifts are designed to deliver a long working life with minimal downtime and low maintenance costs.  Proportional motor and pump rotation conserve battery energy allowing for longer duty cycles as well as charging off the top of the battery, extending the overall life of the battery.

In June, German rental company, Roggermaier GmbH, became the first European customer for the new lifts, with an initial delivery of 50 units. 

The new scissor lifts are now in production in Snorkel’s UK-based manufacturing facility and are available to order via Ahern Deutschland at the show.

6707.post_title: Snorkel Introduces Snorkel Guard™ And Product Upgrades At Platformers' Days
6707.post_content:
Hohenroda, Germany (11th September 2015) As part of ongoing product improvements, Snorkel will unveil upgrades to two of its most popular lifts at Platformers’ Days, as well as showcasing Snorkel Guard™, which is now a standard feature on boom lifts over 12.1m (40-feet).

Introducing Snorkel Guard™

Snorkel Guard™ is the new secondary guarding solution, developed by Snorkel’s in-house engineering team.  Designed to minimize complexity, the simple mechanical system features a spring-mounted rail that sits above the upper control panel that cuts out machine operations when compressed, for example, in the case of the operator being involuntarily pushed against the controls.

The operator can override Snorkel Guard™ using a switch in the platform in the event that the system is activated in error.  Additionally when Snorkel Guard™ is activated, the lift can be operated from the lower control panel.

All new-build Snorkel boom lifts with platform heights of 12.1m (40-feet) and above will be fitted with Snorkel Guard™ as standard from 1st September 2015. In addition, the Snorkel Guard™ system can be easily retrofitted to most Snorkel booms in the field.  Now available, the retrofit kit can be ordered by German customers through Ahern Deutschland.

Upgrades to Existing Snorkel Models

In addition to the introduction of Snorkel Guard™, the company continues to implement product upgrades across its existing range, further improving the customer experience.

The popular Snorkel A38E electric articulated boom lift has been enhanced with hydraulic platform rotate which is now fitted as standard globally.  The previous model had a fixed platform as standard, with manual platform rotate available as an option.

Hydraulic platform rotate improves both operator efficiency, thanks to being able to operate it in tandem with other functions, and also improves access, allowing the operator to work within a greater area without needing to reposition the lift.

The Snorkel compact rough terrain scissor lift, which includes the S2770RT, S3370RT and S3970RT models have also recently been upgraded.  Shown for the first time at Platformers’ Days, the latest version incorporates a new control system that is consistent with many other Snorkel models, including the new line of electric slab scissor lifts.  

The new control system improves serviceability, through its easy-to-read visual display and simple diagnostics.  In addition, the operator will benefit from smoother operation of the lift, and rental/fleet customers will benefit from reduced parts inventory and easier troubleshooting.

Both of the upgraded models will be on display on the Ahern Deutschland stand at Platformers’ Days.

6729.post_title: Thirty Snorkel Electric Boom Lifts For Gerken
6729.post_content:
Weyerbusch, Germany (10th June 2017) Ahern Deutschland, the sales and service provider for Snorkel lift in Germany and Austria, has delivered thirty Snorkel A38E electric boom lifts to German rental company, Gerken.

The thirty Snorkel A38E electric booms lifts were manufactured and custom-painted in Snorkel’s Vigo Centre facility in the U.K.  They were delivered by Ahern Deutschland in Gerken’s distinctive red paint, in a ‘ready to rent’ condition with all decals and livery applied. From Ahern Deutschland’s facility, the lifts were shipped directly to Gerken branches and immediately deployed into the rental fleet.

Gerken is one of the leading aerial work platform rental companies in Europe, with locations across Germany and Spain.  There are over 4,200 aerial work platforms in the Gerken rental fleet, consisting of over 400 different models, including a selection of lifts with working heights over 60 meters (196 ft.).

Originally established in 1963 as a painting business, Gerken Arbeitsbuehnenvermietung, was set up in 1989 focused on the rental of high quality aerial work platforms. The family-owned business celebrated its 50th anniversary in 2013.

The Snorkel A38E is a direct electric drive articulating boom lift that can lift up to 215kg (475 lbs.) to a working height of 13.5m (44 ft.). It has an outreach of 5.9m (19 ft.), yet weighs just 3,795kg (8,366 lbs.).

Mr. Christian Gerken said, “We are delighted to add the Snorkel A38E to our fleet, giving our customers even more choice when selecting a safe means to work at height. The Snorkel A38E is a well-established product that delivers the rare combination of an excellent working envelope with a low machine weight. We have been very impressed with the service from Ahern Deutschland so far, and look forward to continuing our relationship with them in future.”

Bernhard Kahn, General Manager at Ahern Deutschland, said “Gerken is one of the leading rental companies in Germany and we are proud to supply them. The Snorkel A38E is a differentiating product for rental companies and we are thrilled that Gerken saw the advantages of this model and put their trust in us. We look forward to supporting the Gerken team and are delighted to be accepted as a new supplier to them.” 

All thirty Snorkel A38E lifts have been delivered and deployed into the rental fleet. For more information on Gerken, visit www.gerken-arbeitsbuehnen.com.

6746.post_title: Snorkel Compact Bi-Energy Scissor Lifts For HVS
6746.post_content:
Weyerbusch, Germany (8th July 2017) Ahern Deutschland, the sales and service provider for Snorkel lifts in Germany and Austria, has delivered two compact rough terrain scissor lifts, plus three low level units to German rental company, HVS Hubarbeitsbühnen.

The order, which is comprised of a Snorkel S2770BE and a S3370BE compact bi-energy scissor lift, along with two Snorkel TM12 self-propelled mast lifts, and a Snorkel S3010E self-propelled mini scissor lift, was handed over by Roman Heindl, Area Manager for Southern Germany for Ahern Deutschland.

Founded in 1996 by Mr. Friedel Sturhahn, HVS Hubarbeitsbühnen today operates a rental fleet of over 400 units, and employs 20 people.  Due to the success of the business, HVS moved to new premises in Steinhagen in 2015 to accommodate the expansion of the fleet and the team. 

Friedel Sturhahn, Owner of HVS, said, “We have worked with Roman Heindl for many years, and we are very impressed with the level of customer and technical service that we are receiving from Ahern Deutschland. Indeed, having access to “ready to rent” stock machines in Germany is a great benefit. On this particular order, we received a rental order for three low level machines on the same day that we were collecting the bi-energy scissor lifts. These low level machines were already in stock in Ahern Deutschland’s facility, so we were able to add them to the order and take them with us on the same day. This is a major bonus for rental companies in the region.”

Mr Sturhahn added, “We are keen to invest in our fleet for the future, and we were very interested when we saw the Snorkel bi-energy scissor lifts.  This is a unique hybrid drive option that provides two separate power source options, electric and diesel, both with a permanent all-wheel drive system and oscillating axle.  This brings flexibility to our fleet, and to our customers when on the jobsite – we’re excited to have these models available.”

Bernhard Kahn, General Manager at Ahern Deutschland, said, “The Snorkel bi-energy scissor lifts offer an particularly attractive solution to rental companies as a single unit can be rented to customers requiring either electric or diesel power.  They are also likely to be rented longer term, as a customer can use them on the rough terrain at the start of the project and then indoors as the building progresses.  We are pleased that HVS were able to benefit from our ‘ready to rent’ stock machines, and thank Mr. Sturhahn and his team for trusting in Ahern Deutschland and Snorkel. We look forward to continuing to build our relationship with them.”

For more information on HVS Hubarbeitsbühnen, visit www.hvs-hubarbeitsbuehnen.de.

6764.post_title: Ahern Deutschland Celebrates Second Anniversary At Platformers’ Days Exhibition
6764.post_content:
Weyerbusch, Germany (8th September 2017) Officially launched at Platformers’ Days 2015, Ahern Deutschland will be celebrating its second anniversary at the upcoming Platformers’ Days exhibition on September 8-9, 2017.

Showcasing 12 Snorkel aerial work platforms, Ahern Deutschland will be running a number of exclusive Platformers’ Days promotions to show attendees, including free customer color paint on orders of two or more Snorkel lifts placed at the show.

Along with the birthday festivities, the Snorkel ML18C material lift and the Snorkel S2255BE rough terrain scissor lift will both be making their official debut in the German market.

The Snorkel ML18C is part of the new Snorkel family of material lifts, which includes a total of six models. Designed for heavy-duty, construction applications, this machine is a high specification material lift featuring a dual handle, shift-on-the-fly, two-speed winch for improved productivity.

In 2006, Snorkel introduced the narrow width S2255RT and S2755RT machines to the New Zealand market in an effort to meet local demand for a narrow width machine that could be easily transported by contractors using a tandem trailer. Offering a maximum working height of 8.5m, the Snorkel S2255RT has a lift capacity of 420kg from a chassis that is 1.45m wide. The S2755RT offers a maximum working height of 10.4m, and can lift up to 300kg. Capable of climbing gradients of up to 35% and designed to be towed by light commercial vehicles, the Snorkel S2255RT weighs just 2,360kg, while the S2755RT weighs 2,580kg.

Earlier this year, these narrow scissor lifts were introduced in Europe. At Platformers’ Days, Ahern Deutschland will show the bi-energy S2255BE that can switch between diesel power for outdoor work and electric power for indoor work.  Weighing in at 2,660kg, the S2255BE also comes equipped with high grip, non-marking tires as standard, and shares all other features with the diesel-powered S2255RT.

The Ahern Deutschland stand will include a “low level access” zone to showcase Snorkel low-level products that are available for working at heights of up to five meters. Ahern Deutschland will be displaying two mini scissor lifts, including the Snorkel S3010E and S3010P, as well as the Snorkel TM12, a self-propelled telescopic mast lift.

Snorkel’s mini scissor lifts offer an alternative to traditional low-level solutions, such as ladders, scaffolding towers, and podiums, delivering many additional productivity and safety benefits. The self-propelled Snorkel S3010E has compact dimensions and a zero inside turning radius, making it ideal for working in tight spaces, and is light enough to be carried in elevators. 

On the 225sqm open-air stand at Platformers’ Days, Ahern Deutschland will display the Snorkel A38E and A46JRT articulated boom lifts, along with the Snorkel S3219E, S3226E, and S4732E electric slab scissor lifts. Also on display will be the Snorkel S3370BE compact scissor lift, the Snorkel SL30SL speed level lift, and the Snorkel UL25 push-around mast lift.

Visit Ahern Deutschland at Stand #FG GF 18-2 at Platformers’ Days in Hohenroda, Germany. Ahern Deutschland will be celebrating their two-year anniversary ‘American’ style with American hotdogs and hospitality throughout the show. 

For more information on Ahern Deutschland, please visit www.aherndeutschland.de.

6770.post_title: Snorkel & Xtreme Enter Latin America Through Ahern Chile Distribution Channel
6770.post_content:
Santiago, Chile (13th December 2016)  Snorkel and Xtreme Manufacturing are pleased to announce the official grand opening of Ahern Chile, the new sales and service provider for the companies in Latin America. 

Based in Santiago, Ahern Chile is the latest location in the Ahern International distribution group, that also includes Ahern Australia, Ahern Japan, Ahern Deutschland and Ahern Canada.  The Ahern International entities are focused on the distribution of Snorkel and Xtreme Manufacturing products, as well as the provision of spare parts and technical service.  The Ahern International businesses do not offer equipment rental.

Led by Brody McFarland, VP of Sales for Latin America for Xtreme Manufacturing and Snorkel, Ahern Chile made its first entry into the Latin American market at ConExpo Latin America in October 2015, showcasing a range of Snorkel aerial work platforms and Xtreme telehandlers.  Following a strong level of interest at the show, Brody appointed Nicolas Pacifico as Regional General Operations Manager in December 2015.  Nicolas has a strong background in aerial work platform sales in the region, having previously led the sales operations in Chile for Haulotte.  This was followed by the appointment of Andre Mendonca as Regional Sales Manager for Argentina, and Carlos Vegar as Parts Manager.

In March 2016, Ahern Chile made their first product sale to local customer, Metalmar, and signed a lease on a facility located in a prominent position in Santiago city on Chile Route 5, which runs from the Peru border and is Chile’s longest highway.  The facility includes over 250sqm (2,690 sq. ft.) of modern office space, as well as 2,000sqm (21,527 sq. ft.) of workshop and warehouse space, including separate parts storage. 

Following a short period of fit-out work, Ahern Chile opened the facility in June 2016, followed by the appointment of Matias Fuentas as Office Manager in October 2016, plus the investment in sales and service vehicles.  The Ahern Chile warehouse is stocked with new Snorkel lifts and Xtreme telehandlers, ready for fast delivery to customers in Chile, and across Latin America.

Brody McFarland said, “Chile is the perfect location to establish our distribution for Latin America.  This is a stable market, with an open trade environment that makes it easy to do business.  Our investment in this market has been very well received by customers so far, and we have many possibilities for expanding our business here into sectors beyond rental, including industrial and mining.”

“Snorkel is already reasonably well-established in Latin America, thanks to the work of our independent distributors, however Xtreme Manufacturing is a new brand in the market.  We are fortunate that some of the regions, such as Argentina, already understand the value of high capacity telehandlers within oil applications, so we already seeing a lot of interest in the larger Xtreme models.  Lower capacity telehandlers commonly used within construction and utilities are still a fairly new concept across Latin America, but we are already working with some of our existing customers to demonstrate the safety and productivity benefits of telehandlers over truck cranes.”
 
Matthew Elvin, CEO for Snorkel and Xtreme Manufacturing said, “The opening of Ahern Chile follows our business philosophy of ‘think global, act local’.  This investment ensures that we are set up to not only sell the equipment, but also effectively support our Latin American customers on a local level.” 

The grand opening event on Tuesday 13th December, marked the official launch of Ahern Chile. Over 100 rental and end user customers from across Latin America travelled to Santiago for the event, which included machine demonstrations, an official ribbon cutting ceremony and an evening of festivities.

6780.post_title: Bolivian Food Producer Gets A Taste For Snorkel Scissor Lifts
6780.post_content:
Santiago, Chile (28th July 2017) Ahern Chile, the sales and service provider for Snorkel lifts in Latin America, is pleased to announce the delivery of the first Snorkel electric scissor lifts into Bolivia.

Two Snorkel S3219E electric scissor lifts were delivered to Avícola Sofia, one of the largest food producers in the region in April 2017.  They have since added to their fleet with two Snorkel S4732E electric scissor lifts delivered in June 2017.

Founded in 1976 in Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Sofia Ltda. started out in poultry, before expanding to a wider range of meat products, that today includes the production of hamburgers and frozen foods.  Sofia Ltda. was the first food production company in Bolivia to achieve ISO certification for food safety along with the BPM Good Manufacturing Practices Certification, which they have maintained since 2006.

 The Snorkel S3219E scissor lifts will be used within their plant in La Paz, Bolivia for installation projects and facilities maintenance.  The Snorkel S4732E scissor lifts will be working inside the refrigerated storage unit.  The scissor lifts were sold and will be serviced by ASERPRO in Santa Cruz, who are a local dealer for Ahern Chile, and were handed over by Carlos Vejar, Regional Service Manager for Ahern Chile, who performed the pre-delivery inspection, and provided familiarization training on-site with the Avícola Sofia team.

Engineer Walter Melgares, Chief Project Manager at Avícola Sofia, said, “We selected the Snorkel scissor lifts based on their robust build quality and simplicity of operation and maintenance.  We have been extremely impressed with the service provided by ASERPRO and Ahern Chile, and look forward to developing our relationship in future.”

Brody McFarland, Vice President of Sales for Latin America for Snorkel, said, “We are incredibly grateful to Avícola Sofia for putting their trust in Snorkel, Ahern Chile, and our valued partner, ASERPRO. It is a honour to deliver the first Snorkel electric scissor lifts into Bolivia, and we look forward to supporting this customer, and building our presence in the region moving forward.”

6786.post_title: Dromad Hire Adds New Snorkel Lifts To Its Fleet
6786.post_content:
Washington, Tyne & Wear, U.K. (25th July 2016) Irish rental company, Dromad Hire, has invested in two new Snorkel A38E boom lifts, in a deal closed at Vertikal Days 2016.

Founded in 1988, Dromad Hire is a fully Irish owned family operated plant and tool hire business, that is based in Dundalk in the Republic of Ireland. They have recently expanded into specialized powered access hire, and in 2014 were the first hire company in Ireland to be awarded ‘Safe Hire’ status, a standard that continues to be retained.

The Snorkel A38E is an electric articulated boom lift that delivers 13.5m working height, and up to 5.9m of horizontal reach, and is fitted with non-marking tyres as standard.  It has an ultra-tight turning radius, is less than 1.5m wide, and has a 90° hydraulically powered platform rotate for easier platform positioning at height. Weighing just 3,770kg, the A38E is ideal for working indoors on floors where ground pressure is limited.  

Dromad Hire managing director Seamus Byrne said: “We have been running Snorkel A38E’s in our fleet now for some time, so the machine is already proven to us. Snorkel UK provide us with excellent backup and support so this made our decision over choosing other manufacturers a very easy one.”

“The new A38E models further extends our product offering in electric boom lifts, which are increasingly in demand with our customers due to their use in specialized applications – particularly indoor use.”

Snorkel UK is the direct sales and service operation for Snorkel lifts in the UK and Ireland. The order from Dromad Hire was placed with Snorkel UK during Vertikal Days 2016, and will be supported by the Snorkel UK team.

Andrew Fishburn, Divisional Managing Director of Snorkel UK added, “We are thrilled that Dromad Hire have decided to expand their fleet of Snorkel A38E boom lifts. This is a very popular model that has already been well received by their customer base, and we are grateful for their continued support and trust.” 

“I am also extremely pleased that our level of support played a part in securing this order – our team work very hard to deliver the highest standards of customer service possible and it is great to have this recognized by leading hire companies, such as Dromad Hire.”

Dromad Hire has already taken delivery of the two new electric articulated boom lifts, that are now deployed within their hire fleet.

6792.post_title: Charleville Plant Hire Grows Fleet With Snorkel
6792.post_content:
Washington, Tyne & Wear, U.K. (14th June 2018) One of Munster and Ireland’s leading plant, access and tool hire companies has expanded its fleet with the addition of multiple Snorkel lifts.

Working with Dave Roddy of Snorkel UK since 2017, Charleville Hire & Platform Ltd T/A CPH have added numerous Snorkel electric scissor lifts, electric boom lifts, and diesel boom lifts to their hire fleet. Most recently, CPH have invested in the innovative Snorkel Speed Level, and placed an order at Vertikal Days for two new Snorkel SR626 rough terrain compact telehandlers and a Snorkel A46JRT diesel articulated boom lift.

Owned by James Dundon and Martin Hanley, CPH operate from three branches, located in Charleville, Cork City and Limerick. They have a modern fleet of hire equipment, including everything from hand tools to large access platforms, telehandlers and excavators, and they maintain a focus on delivering high quality, reliable products to their customer, on time.

At Vertikal Days 2018, Snorkel UK displayed a CPH branded Snorkel Speed Level on the stand, and CPH owners, James and Martin had the opportunity to meet with Snorkel’s owner, Don Ahern during the show.

James Dundon, owner at CPH, said, “We have known Dave Roddy for many years, and we are grateful that he introduced us to the Snorkel product line in 2017. We have been impressed with the products that we have added to the fleet so far, and many of our customers now ask for the Snorkel brand by name when hiring access equipment from us.”

“It was also great to meet Don Ahern at Vertikal Days – he is clearly passionate about both Snorkel and the hire industry, and we certainly share his excitement for the future of the market.  We are looking forward to putting our new Snorkel telehandlers out on hire.”

Andrew Fishburn, Managing Director of Snorkel UK, added, “We are thrilled to have CPH as a Snorkel UK customer. They are a well-respected and established hire company, with a great reputation. We are grateful to James and Martin for the trust they placed in Dave as he introduced the product line to them, and we thank them for the continued business.”

For more information on CPH, visit www.cphltd.ie. For more information on Snorkel UK, visit www.snorkellifts.co.uk.

6800.post_title: Fifty Snorkel Lifts For Ayhanlar Platform
6800.post_content:
Washington, Tyne & Wear, U.K. (28th October 2017) Leading Turkish rental company, Ayhanlar Platform, has invested in fifty Snorkel lifts from official Snorkel distributor, Uzman Lift.

The order, which was placed in September, consisted of forty Snorkel S3219E and six Snorkel S3226E electric slab scissor lifts, along with two Snorkel A46JE and two Snorkel A46JRT articulated boom lifts. All of the lifts were delivered to Ayhanlar Platform immediately from Uzman Lift stock, held near Istanbul, and were handed over by Mehmet Karakaya, General Manager at Uzman Lift, and Matthew Elvin, CEO and Michael Wright, Regional Sales Director – MEA, for Snorkel. 

Ayhanlar Platform was founded in 1997 to support the Turkish market with the supply of high reach platforms. They operate from four branches, based in Istanbul, Gebze and Kayseri, and run a rental fleet of 650 platforms, ranging from platform heights of 5m to 70m. They also offer a specialist fleet of ultra-high platforms, under the BigLift division, which are commonly supplied to the wind power industry for turbine installation and maintenance.

Necip Ayhan, General Manager at Ayhanlar Platforms said, “We were introduced to the new Snorkel electric scissor lifts by Uzman Lift, and we were very impressed with the features that have been designed into the lift to lower the total cost of ownership. Uzman Lift were able to provide immediate delivery, and this has been followed up by a visit from a Snorkel product support engineer who came to train our technicians quickly after we received the lifts. We are very happy so far with the products and the service, and look forward to building this relationship.”

Mehmet Karakaya, General Manager at Uzman Lift, added “We are very grateful to Mr. Ayhan and Ayhanlar Platform for this opportunity. We are committed to delivering the highest levels of customer service and I am pleased that we were able to support this request from stock. We are also grateful for the support of our partner, Snorkel.”

Matthew Elvin, CEO at Snorkel, said “I was honored to be welcomed to Ayhanlar Platform, and to be part of the handover of one of our largest deliveries into Turkey to date. On behalf of Snorkel, I would like to express my sincere thanks to Ayhanlar Platform for their investment, and to Uzman Lift for their continued hard work and dedication to the promotion of Snorkel in the Turkish market.”

Following delivery, Snorkel provided technical training for the Ayhanlar Platform service engineers, equipping them with the skills to service, maintain and repair lifts for optimum performance within the rental fleet. 

For more information on Ayhanlar Platform, please visit www.ayhanlar.com/en-us/. For more information on Uzman Lift, please visit www.uzmanlift.com.

6814.post_content:
Washington, Tyne & Wear, U.K. (10th August 2017) Turkish rental company, Fatih Vinç, has invested in thirty-five Snorkel lifts, from official distributor, Uzman Lift.

The deal, which was signed on Friday 28th July at Uzman Lift headquarters in Istanbul, includes 21 Snorkel electric scissor lifts, 7 Snorkel compact rough terrain scissor lifts, 3 Snorkel electric boom lifts, plus a T46JRT telescopic boom lift, two Snorkel TM12 telescopic mast lifts and a Snorkel S3010P push around mini scissor lift. The majority of the lifts will be delivered immediately from Uzman Lift stock, with the remaining lifts shipping from the Snorkel manufacturing facility in the U.K.

Fatih Vinç were established in 1985 in Bursa city as a crane company. As the company developed, Managing Director, Mr. Kenan Aydin, discovered the potential for aerial work platforms in Turkey, and began investing in the products in 2009. Today, Fatih Vinç is one of the leading AWP rental companies in Turkey, with a fleet of more than 800 units. 

The Snorkel lifts from this order will be immediately deployed into their rental fleet. Mr. Kenan Aydin said, “We appreciate the efforts of Uzman Lift who have worked hard during the past year to introduce Fatih Vinç to Snorkel products and win this order. Snorkel has made significant progress under Don Ahern’s ownership, and we are very impressed with the product design and quality.  We also know that Uzman Lift have completed Snorkel’s technical training and we are confident in their ability to support the products in our fleet. Thanks again to Uzman Lift for their support.”

Mehmet Karakaya, General Manager at Uzman Lift, said, “We are incredibly grateful to Fatih Vinç for placing their trust in Uzman Lift and the Snorkel brand, with this significant order. We know that the lifts will be a great addition to their fleet, and we look forward to supporting Fatih Vinç with the technical training and after sales support to help them maximize their return on investment.”

Matthew Elvin, CEO, Snorkel, added, “I would like to thank Fatih Vinç for their investment in Snorkel lifts. I would also like to congratulate Mehmet, Yusuf and the Uzman Lift team who I know have worked hard to win this order, and are building a solid foundation for success in the Turkish market.”

Since their appointment as an official Snorkel distributor, Uzman Lift have invested heavily in machine and spare parts stock, marketing the Snorkel brand, and their technical capabilities, having recently sent a team of technicians to the Snorkel UK facility for training.

For more details on Fatih Vinç, please visit www.fatihvinc.com.tr. For more information on Uzman Lift, please visit www.uzmanlift.com.

6816.post_title: Snorkel New Zealand Launches New Website
6816.post_content:
Rotorua, North Island, New Zealand (3rd July 2018) Snorkel New Zealand is pleased to announce the launch of a brand-new website dedicated to the New Zealand market. 

Snorkel New Zealand provides sales, parts and service for Snorkel aerial lifts in the North & South Islands, through its Snorkel sales team and nationwide service dealer network.

Backed by the Snorkel manufacturing and rebuild facility in Levin on the North Island, Snorkel New Zealand has easy access to a wide range of new lifts, spare parts, as well as factory-based engineering and technical expertise. 

The new website, which is now live at www.snorkellifts.co.nz, provides a clean and user-friendly interface to browse the entire Snorkel product line, including some locally designed models, as well as make quick contact with the local Snorkel New Zealand team for sales, service or spare parts enquiries, and keep up to date with the latest Snorkel news and events.

At the annual HIANZ Hire Conference in Rotorua from 3rd to 5th July 2018, Snorkel New Zealand will display a range of Snorkel lifts, including the Snorkel S2255RT narrow rough terrain scissor lift on a purpose-built-trailer, along with the Snorkel S3215E and S3219E electric slab scissor lifts, and a Snorkel S3010P push-around mini scissor lift.

To celebrate the 40th anniversary of HIANZ, Snorkel New Zealand will be giving show visitors the chance to reminisce with a specially-produced looping video which shows the 40-year history of Snorkel’s New Zealand manufacturing facility in Levin.

Find Snorkel New Zealand at HIANZ 2018 at their adjoining stands 15 & 24.  For more information on Snorkel New Zealand, please visit the new website at www.snorkellifts.co.nz.

6823.post_title: Snorkel Introduces New Tier 4 Compliant Engine To A46jrt Model
6823.post_content:

6848.post_title: American Rentals, Inc. Wins Snorkel S3010P At Cra Rental Rally 2018
6848.post_content:
Las Vegas, Nevada (12th February 2018) Snorkel continued its tradition of giving away a push-around mini scissor lift at the annual California Rental Association (CRA) Rental Rally in Las Vegas, Nevada, recently. 

During the end of show raffle on Wednesday, January 24, Snorkel owner, Don Ahern announced Kevin Davis of American Rentals Inc., as the fifth person to take home a free scissor lift from the show.  Entrants had to submit their business card on the Snorkel booth during the show, and be present at the end of show raffle to be eligible to win.

Kevin follows in the footsteps of Lynne Domey of Eastern Oregon Rental & Sales, who took home the push-around lift in 2017, and Tony Beringer of Baker Rentals & Sales in Costa Mesa, Caifornia, who won in 2016.

To celebrate giving away the fifth scissor lift at the show, Snorkel upgraded the prize from the Snorkel S3008P to the Snorkel S3010P.  Designed for low-level construction and facilities maintenance applications, the Snorkel S3010P is an innovative push-around mini scissor lift, which provides a cost-effective way to safely work at low level heights indoors.  Capable of withstanding the demands of construction sites and the rental industry, the Snorkel S3010P can lift 430 lbs. (195kg) to a working height of 15 ft. 10 in (4.82m).

During the prize draw, Don Ahern reinforced his support for independent rental companies, stating that “Independent rental companies are the heart and soul of this industry, and it is great to be part of the California Rental Association. The lucky winner of the Snorkel S3010P not only wins a scissor lift, but also a lifetime of rental return. I would like to send my congratulations to American Rentals, Inc. who I am sure will benefit from having this innovative product in their fleet.”

6875.post_title: Snorkel Unveils New Products At The Rental Show 2015
6875.post_content:
Las Vegas, Nevada (12th February 2018) Snorkel continued its tradition of giving away a push-around mini scissor lift at the annual California Rental Association (CRA) Rental Rally in Las Vegas, Nevada, recently. 

During the end of show raffle on Wednesday, January 24, Snorkel owner, Don Ahern announced Kevin Davis of American Rentals Inc., as the fifth person to take home a free scissor lift from the show.  Entrants had to submit their business card on the Snorkel booth during the show, and be present at the end of show raffle to be eligible to win.

Kevin follows in the footsteps of Lynne Domey of Eastern Oregon Rental & Sales, who took home the push-around lift in 2017, and Tony Beringer of Baker Rentals & Sales in Costa Mesa, Caifornia, who won in 2016.

To celebrate giving away the fifth scissor lift at the show, Snorkel upgraded the prize from the Snorkel S3008P to the Snorkel S3010P.  Designed for low-level construction and facilities maintenance applications, the Snorkel S3010P is an innovative push-around mini scissor lift, which provides a cost-effective way to safely work at low level heights indoors.  Capable of withstanding the demands of construction sites and the rental industry, the Snorkel S3010P can lift 430 lbs. (195kg) to a working height of 15 ft. 10 in (4.82m).

During the prize draw, Don Ahern reinforced his support for independent rental companies, stating that “Independent rental companies are the heart and soul of this industry, and it is great to be part of the California Rental Association. The lucky winner of the Snorkel S3010P not only wins a scissor lift, but also a lifetime of rental return. I would like to send my congratulations to American Rentals, Inc. who I am sure will benefit from having this innovative product in their fleet.”

American Rentals’ sales representative, Kevin Davis, won the Snorkel S3010P. Headquartered in Long Beach, California, American Rentals was founded in 1984 as American Truck and Tool Rentals. Today, American Rentals operates multiple locations in Orange and Los Angeles Counties serving the construction and industrial segments.

6898.post_title: The Rental Show 2015 Sets The Stage For The Launch Of Snorkel’s First Ever Telehandler
6898.post_content:
New Orleans (February 23, 2015) – Snorkel is officially debuting its first ever telehandler at The Rental Show in New Orleans this week.  The Snorkel SR5919 is the first model of the brand new line of rough terrain telescopic handlers. 

The SR5919 can lift up to 5,900 lbs, has a 19-foot maximum lift height, and an 11-foot maximum forward reach.  The machine is 71-inches wide and 6-foot 7-inches tall with a 10.8-inch ground clearance, and an 11-foot turning radius. 

The heavy-duty, all-steel lift is designed to give the operator full 360° visibility from the cab, improving jobsite safety and productivity. The lift is available with a choice of open cab, enclosed cab, or enclosed cab with heat and AC, and is fitted with a suspension seat as standard, as well as a solid steel dash with display screen and suspended pedals.

Built to perform in rental and construction applications, the SR5919 has a solid steel plate chassis, a large cross-section boom with wear pads and protected tilt and extend cylinders to prevent damage, steel hydraulic and fuel tanks, with a 17 gallon fuel capacity, melonite pins and a ductile steel manifold.

The Snorkel SR5919 is a cost-competitive, high quality telehandler that is now available for order.  For more information, please visit http://www.snorkellifts.com/.

7023.post_title: Snorkel Unveils New Boom Platform Design & ‘Snorkel Guard’ Secondary Guarding System
7023.post_content:
New Orleans (February 23, 2015) – Snorkel is showing a new boom platform design at The Rental Show which will be introduced on the new family of mid-size boom lifts, which are also being launched at the show.  The new platform will be rolled out across the Snorkel boom range in future.

The new 8-foot x 3-foot platform design incorporates rear saloon gates as standard, plus two side gravity bars for tri-entry, allowing the operator to access the platform from all sides, even when the lift is positioned near obstacles.

Designed with the rental industry in mind, the new platform can be repaired and replaced easily and affordably.  The entire platform weldment can be removed with just 6 bolts, making it quick and easy to switch out different sized platforms for specific applications, and easy to replace damaged platforms, reducing machine downtime.  The platform electrics, such as the control box, secondary guarding system, and footswitch are mounted directly to the pedestal, meaning that there is no wiring which needs to be changed during the platform replacement process.

The platform floor is also removable, so rental companies do not need to change out the entire platform if the flooring is damaged. 

The new platform design is fitted with a light-duty panel carrier as standard, which is suitable for lifting lightweight sheets such as drywall. The panel carrier is built-into the platform steel work, reducing the chance of damage, loss or theft.

Furthermore, Snorkel is pleased to announce that the new platform design will be fitted with the new in-house designed ‘Snorkel Guard’ secondary guarding system.  This is a spring-mounted rail that sits above the upper control panel and cuts out machine operations when compressed, such as in the case of the operator being struck by an overhead obstacle.  The system has a switch in the platform that allows the operator to override the system if activated in error.  When the system is activated, the lift can be operated from the lower control panel.

The new platform will be fitted as standard on all new Snorkel mid-size boom lifts, and will be available in the Summer. 

The ‘Snorkel Guard’ system is available to order now, and can be retrofitted to most existing Snorkel booms with platform heights of 40-feet and above.

Both the new platform and the ‘Snorkel Guard’ secondary guarding system can be seen on the Snorkel booth at The Rental Show – booth #9213.

7144.post_title: Snorkel LAUNCHES New Mid-Size Telescopic Boom LIFT AT THE RENTAL SHOW 2016
7144.post_content:
Atlanta, Georgia (February 22, 2016)  Snorkel will officially launch the production version of its new Snorkel 660SJ at The Rental Show 2016. The Snorkel 660SJ will be the largest model in the new family of four mid-sized boom lifts, which includes the 400S, 460SJ and 600S.

It is equipped with a 60-ft. 2-in. (18.3m) boom plus a 6-ft. 6-in. (2.0m) jib boom which articulates 135°, from -65° to +70°. The Snorkel 660SJ delivers 66-ft. 8-in. (20.3m) maximum platform height, 59-ft. (18m) maximum outreach, and can lift up to 600 lbs. (272kg). It measures 7-ft. 10-in. (2.38m) wide and its 34-ft. 5-in. (10.4m) stowed length can be reduced to 28 ft. (8.5m) for transport by stowing the jib underneath the boom.

Excellent Rough Terrain Performance

Built to handle tough environments, the Snorkel 660SJ delivers excellent rough terrain performance thanks to a traction manifold that delivers oil to all four wheels at all times, providing constant 4-wheel drive.  It can also tackle gradients of up to 43%. The lift has fixed axles as standard, reducing complexity and risk of downtime. Oscillating axles are available as an option.


Durability Combined with Simplicity

The 660SJ features a steel, 4-plate ‘top hat’ style boom weldment that is manufactured in Selma, Calif., a durable steel cowling and has two individual steel doors on each side of the lift, in the traditional Snorkel-style. The turret offers 360° continuous rotation, and delivers a constant 47-in (1.2m) tailswing radius to prevent collisions when slewing the machine. 

The lift also has a new steel chassis that will be common across all new Snorkel mid-size telescopic and articulated booms, helping to standardize parts and create familiarity for service engineers. Simplicity remains at the heart of Snorkel’s design philosophy, and the 660SJ has open-loop hydraulics and CAN-BUS controllers, which will be common across all future boom models for easier maintenance, service and training.

The operator benefits from all proportional functions, including drive, raise, slew and extend.  Jib and platform rotate are also proportional representing a first in the AWP industry.

Loaded with Innovative Features

Finally, the 660SJ showcases Snorkel’s new, innovative 8-ft. x 3-ft. tri-entry platform design with saloon doors, which has 150° platform rotation for precise positioning.

Additionally, the lift is equipped with Snorkel Guard™ secondary guarding system as standard.  The new platform also features a built-in, light duty panel carrier. For ease of maintenance, the new platform can be easily switched out, without the need to disconnect the hydraulics or wiring, minimizing downtime.

The Snorkel 660SJ is now available to order.  Find Snorkel at Booth #3423 at The Rental Show 2016.

7152.post_title: Snorkel Founder Art Moore Launches His Memoirs At The Rental Show 2016
7152.post_content:
Atlanta, Georgia (February 22, 2016) Snorkel’s founder, Art Moore, debuts his memoirs at The Rental Show 2016 trade show. He will be in attendance at the show to debut his autobiography, detailing his journey as one of the most respected professionals in the aerial lift industry.

Art Moore founded the Snorkel Company in 1959, introducing a revolutionary firefighting and rescue apparatus.  In 1977, he led Snorkel in developing the “Snorkelift”, a superior aerial work platform. During the 1980’s Snorkel was a leader in the AWP market. In October 2013, Xtreme Manufacturing, owned by Don Ahern, acquired the majority shares of Snorkel. Art retired in 1991, but remains on the Board of Directors at Snorkel.

Art said, “I am honored and excited to be able write this memoir and relive many wonderful memories from my time at Snorkel. I am particularly grateful to Don Ahern for his support in making My Story a reality.”

Art started writing his memoirs in 2003, from what was intended to be a letter to a company that was producing a “die-cast model” of the Snorkel fire truck.  Their brochure had many inaccuracies and he wanted to set the record straight.  Over a period of 11 years, the letter grew to become “My Story”, providing an interesting insight into the founding and workings of a major manufacturing company.

Art’s story takes the reader back to the start of his entrepreneurial career in 1949, when he and childhood friend Ray Pitman partnered up at the Pitman Manufacturing Company. It was there where they developed the “Hydra-Lift” and eventually an industrial “Truck Mounted Aerial Platform” that became “Chicago’s Snorkel No. 1” fire truck. It became so popular that in 1959 Art resigned from Pitman to start his own company, “Snorkel Fire Equipment Company.” The story continues through the development of the company, leading to the eventual sale of Snorkel more than two decades later and the launch of Snorkel’s first “Snorkelift” Aerial Work Platform in 1977.

After retirement, Art and his wife became “snowbirds”, traveling between their home in Pompano Beach, Florida and their summer home in Osage Beach, Missouri on the beautiful Lake of the Ozarks.

Art has been very happily married to his wife Sue for 22 years. He states, “I couldn’t have written my memoirs without her help.” 

“My Story” is now available to order at www.artmoorememoirs.com.

7168.post_title: Snorkel Launches Electric Drive Telescopic Mast Lift And Material Lifts At The Rental Show 2017
7168.post_content:
Orlando, Florida (February 27, 2017) – Snorkel, a leading global manufacturer of aerial lifts, is launching the Snorkel TM12E electric drive telescopic mast lift at The Rental Show 2017.

Originally displayed as a prototype at The Rental Show 2016, the production-ready Snorkel TM12E is now available to order.  The Snorkel TM12E features an efficient electric drive system that delivers longer duty cycles, a zero inside turning radius, and a new electric braking system.  Capable of lifting up to 500 lbs. (227kg) to a platform height of up to 12 ft. (3.6m), the TM12E includes a roll-out deck extension as standard, plus a new upper control box with an integrated power to platform outlet, that is common with Snorkel’s electric slab scissor lift family. 

Snorkel Expands Product Line With Range of Material Lifts

Snorkel is also expanding its product line with the addition of six material lifts.  Delivering best-in-class load capacities, the six lifts all feature a dual-handle, shift-on-the-fly, two-speed winch for increased productivity when lifting loads, up to twice as fast as other material lifts on the market.  To celebrate the launch, Snorkel is running a prize draw to win a Snorkel ML16M material lift on its booth at The Rental Show.

Forty Years Young

At The Rental Show 2017, Snorkel will display the very first Snorkel telescopic boom lift that has recently been fully restored.  The first Snorkel TB-42 was originally launched in 1977, and was still in full working order when it was driven into Snorkel’s rebuild facility in Elwood, Kansas in 2014 to begin the restoration process. The development of the TB-42 was led by Art Moore, Snorkel’s founder, who is being inducted into the American Rental Assocation Hall of Fame at The Rental Show 2017.

For more information on Snorkel, visit Booth #3423 at The Rental Show 2016, or go to www.snorkellifts.com.

7684.post_title: Snorkel S3008P Goes To Eastern Oregon Rental & Sales
7684.post_content:
Las Vegas, Nevada (2nd February 2017) Lynne Domey of Eastern Oregon Rental & Sales was named the lucky winner of a Snorkel S3008P push around scissor lift at the California Rental Association Rental Rally 2017 in Las Vegas yesterday.

Lynne is the fourth person to win a Snorkel S3008P at the show, since 2015. At the CRA Rental Rally 2016, Tony Beringer of Baker Rentals & Sales in Costa Mesa, California was drawn as the winner of the lift.

The winner was announced by Snorkel owner, Don Ahern, during the end of show raffle on Wednesday, Feburary 1, with the winner needing to be present to win.  Don Ahern said, during the draw, “This is a prize that keeps on giving. The lucky winner can add the Snorkel S3008P to their fleet and enjoy a lifetime of rental return on the lift.”

Lynne Domey is the manager at Eastern Oregon Rental & Sales branch in Baker City, OR, as well as the party and event coordinator for the company. After the draw, Lynne said, “This is so exciting and a wonderful end to the show. We can’t wait to add the Snorkel S3008P to our fleet, that will extend our low level access offering to our customers.”

Eastern Oregon Rental & Sales offers an extensive range of aerial work platforms and all terrain forklifts to customers across Eastern Oregon.  Opened originally in 1969 as Jefferson Street Rentals in downtown La Grande, current owner, Cory Braseth purchased the business in 1989 and renamed it to Eastern Oregon Rental and Sales.  The family owned and operated business has added heavy construction equipment to its product offering, and operates from 3 locations, in La Grande, Baker City and Pendleton, OR.

Designed for low-level construction and facilities maintenance applications, the Snorkel S3008P is an innovative push-around mini scissor lift, which provides a cost-effective way to safely work at low level heights indoors.  Designed to withstand the demands of construction sites and the rental industry, the Snorkel S3008P is a heavy-duty and robust mini scissor lift, which is easy to use and simple to maintain.  The S3008P can lift 500 lbs. (227kg) to a working height of 14 ft. 2 in (4.3m).

For more information on the Snorkel S3008P, visit www.snorkellifts.com. For more information on Eastern Oregon Rental & Sales, please visit www.eorentals.com.

7691.post_title: Take Two At Icuee For Xtreme Manufacturing & Snorkel
7691.post_content:
Henderson, Nevada (3 October 2017) On October 3-5, 2017, Xtreme Manufacturing™ and Snorkel™ will team up for round two at the International Construction and Utility Equipment Exposition (ICUEE) in Louisville, KY.

Also known as the Demo Expo, the biennial ICUEE expo is the premiere event for utility industry professionals to gain insight into the latest technologies and trends. In 2015, Xtreme Manufacturing and Snorkel exhibited the 24,000-lb-capacity Xtreme XR2450 telehandler and an SL30SL Speed Level lift with 29’4” platform height and 1,300-lb. capacity.

This year, Xtreme Manufacturing will display a 12,000-lb-capacity Xtreme XR1255 telehandler at booth #2106. With a maximum lift height of 55’ (16.7m) and a 38’ (11.5m) forward reach, the XR1255 is a high-pivot roller boom with excellent rough terrain capabilities. Like all Xtreme telehandlers, the XR1255 features 360° operator visibility from the cab, a machine-rated integrated boom lift point, boom rollers instead of wear pads for minimal maintenance over the life of the machine, and is backed by a 10 year – 5 year – 2 year warranty. 

Alongside the XR1255, Xtreme Manufacturing will also be showcasing a 10’ x 10’ Xtreme Cube. As a division of Xtreme Manufacturing, this modular building system begins with a structural steel space frame that is available in 8ft, 10ft, and 12ft widths and lengths. These frames can be customized to the client’s exact requirements, including walls, doors, windows, electrical, plumbing, décor, and furnishings. Highly portable, Xtreme Cubes are ideal for all types of permanent and temporary facilities, and can be set up in rural and challenging environments.

Rounding out the 900 sq. ft. indoor booth space at ICUEE 2017, Snorkel will be displaying the S3219E electric scissor lift and the A46JRT articulating boom lift. Packed with features that benefit both the owner and the operator, the Snorkel S3219 electric scissor lift sets a new standard within the industry with a working height of 25 ft (7.79m) and a lift capacity of 550 lbs (250kg). The utility specification Snorkel A46JRT rough terrain lift features a Kubota V1505 diesel engine, a 2kW AC generator, two grounding loops, and a 5’ (1.5m) aluminum platform with a swing gate and Snorkel Guard™ secondary guarding system. The optional Snorkel utility package can be added to most Snorkel boom lifts.

For more information about ICUEE, please visit www.icuee.com. For more information on Xtreme Manufacturing, visit www.xmfg.com, and for Snorkel, visit www.snorkellifts.com.  

Visit Snorkel and Xtreme Manufacturing at ICUEE 2017 at booth #2106.
