7795.post_title: Snorkel Launches New Online Warranty Services Portal
7795.post_content:
Henderson, NV, USA (June 6, 2022) Snorkel is very pleased to announce the global launch of its new online warranty services portal.

Now available, the new online warranty services portal allows Snorkel equipment owners to digitally manage all product warranty and warranty claim information. New users can create an account to submit a claim, search and view claim history, and submit labor rate declarations.   The user-friendly online portal provides convenient 24/7 access and up-to-date product warranty information.  There is no change on how claims are processed, we are simply improving the experience to submit and track warranty claims, hopefully improving claim processing times.

The new warranty services portal is the part of a customer support digitization campaign by Snorkel.  While we are still accepting scanned/mailed paper copies of warranty claim submissions, this will be phased out over the coming months.

Jamie Graham, Vice President of Product Support for Xtreme Manufacturing and Snorkel, said, “We are continually looking for opportunities to improve our customer experience, and the launch of this new online warranty services portal is a fantastic development for our customers and product support team. Our customers can now take control of their warranty claim process, with the ability to submit the claim and all supporting materials online, as well as receive status updates as a claim is processed.”

To access the warranty services portal, users can visit www.snorkellifts.com/warranty.

7816.post_title: Snorkel™ Launches New Online Warranty Services

7828.post_title: Snorkel Announces New Managing Director Of New Zealand Production Facility
7828.post_content:
Snorkel has appointed Jonathan “Jonno” Tulitt as the new managing director of its New Zealand manufacturing facility. Jonathan brings more than 20 years’ experience to the role in prior operational and engineering capacities across multiple industries, including passenger rail operations and rail rolling stock manufacturing and engineering.

In his 22-year career, Jonathan has worked for Transdev Australasia (and Veolia Transport Limited prior to its acquisition by Transdev) in both their Auckland and Wellington operations in capacities including performance manager, operations manager, fleet controller, project engineer, general manager of operations, and acting chief operating officer. He has achieved records in the areas of safety, operational performance, and customer service. As general manager of operations for Transdev Wellington, he was able to exceed forecasted performance and earnings in 2020 despite the impact of COVID-19. Prior to his lengthy career at Transdev/Veolia, Jonathan worked as operations manager for Bombardier Transportation where he oversaw operations management, productivity, scheduling, repairs and maintenance of stock, among other duties.

Jonathan also served for 11 years in the New Zealand Air Force as a qualified armament technician undertaking aircraft maintenance, component servicing, explosive store housing and accounting.

Of his new role, Jonathan said, “I changed industries and joined Snorkel New Zealand as I was looking for a new challenge from a professional perspective. Snorkel is a well-known brand, and the opportunity to join a thriving company and contribute to its continued success was too good an opportunity to pass up. The locality of the business also enables me to work closer to home and spend more time with family.”

Jonathan is looking forward to supporting the passionate Snorkel employees as well as the local industry and community while continuing to grow the Snorkel brand in New Zealand and supporting the growth of the business globally.

Matthew Elvin, CEO of Xtreme Manufacturing and Snorkel said, “We are excited to have Jonno join our team. He is dynamic, energetic and results-driven. I am very confident in his ability to combine a hands-on approach with structured business development strategies that will enable him to deliver exceptional results.”

Jonathan replaces Rob Theunissen who retired in December 2021. Rob was president of Snorkel New Zealand, manufacturing manager and company director upon his retirement.

8045.post_title: Snorkel UK Bring Zero Emission Solutions To The Executive Hire Show 2022
8045.post_content:
Snorkel UK returns to the Executive Hire Show today, highlighting zero emission lifting equipment solutions for the hire sector.

With a 50sqm stand inside Hall 1 Snorkel UK is showcasing the Snorkel S2755RTE lithium-electric narrow rough terrain scissor lift as a representation of Snorkel’s range of nine zero emission four-wheel drive models.  Measuring just 1.45m, the Snorkel S2755RTE can reach a maximum working height of 10.1m and can lift capacities up to 300kg. Equipped with maintenance-free lithium-ion battery packs with a built-in battery management system (BMS), the S2755RTE offers a true zero emission rough terrain solution, without compromising on the reliability and four-wheel drive capabilities of the diesel equivalents.

In both test conditions and real-life applications, the standard two battery pack system has been proven to deliver at least an eight-hour shift on a single charge, and in some cases, up to one week between charges, subject to usage. Unlike lead acid batteries, the charging pattern for lithium-ion batteries is designed to seamlessly fit into a normal working day schedule and can be top-up charged during breaks and shift changes.

Designed for outdoor applications, a powerful and efficient AC electric motor creates efficiencies in the hydraulic drive system with higher torque than a diesel engine, which in turn provides improved gradeability and enhanced performance on rough terrain than traditional combustion scissor lifts.

The electric motor also delivers up to 62% less jobsite noise than the diesel equivalent, enabling the lifts to be used indoors or in work environments with noise regulations, and with no engine fan, dust generation is reduced for safer and cleaner operation in low emission zones and green cities. With minimal battery and electrical system maintenance required, servicing costs are reduced by up to 93% when compared to an engine, while also eliminating the costs and risks of waste oil and filter disposal.

Alongside the Snorkel S2755RTE, Snorkel UK will be displaying a range of other electric products, powered by lead acid batteries. These models include a Snorkel A38E electric articulated boom lift, a Snorkel TM12 telescopic mast lift, a Snorkel S3010E self-propelled mini scissor lift, and the Snorkel S3010P push-around scissor lift.

On display outside of the show as visitors arrive at the Ricoh Arena a Snorkel TL37J trailer mounted boom lift is drawing attention to the recently revised towing regulations in the U.K.

The additional test requirement for towing in the U.K. has been removed, which means that anyone with a standard car license can tow up to 3,500kg. Snorkel has 27 different models that can be moved on trailers up to 3,500kg MAM, as well as a range of trailer mounted booms with maximum working heights ranging from 12.9m to 16.7m.

Snorkel UK can be found at Stand B44 in Hall 1 at the Executive Hire Show 2022 at the Ricoh Arena, on Wednesday 9th and Thursday 10th February 2022.

8061.post_title: Rental-Ready: Snorkel Showcases Zero Emission Technology At CRA Rental Rally 2022
8061.post_content:
Snorkel is highlighting its zero emission high reach solutions at the 2022 edition of the CRA Rental Rally which opens today at South Point Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada.

Representing a family of nine lithium-ion battery powered lifts, Snorkel is displaying the fully electric SR5719E compact rough terrain telehandler on its 1,600 sq. ft. (148sqm) booth. Delivering full 4-wheel drive performance and up to 6 hours of continuous use per charge, the SR5719E provides a true zero emission alternative to traditional internal combustion models.

Powered by long-lasting, maintenance-free lithium-ion batteries, the Snorkel SR5719E also reduces dust generation on the jobsite, and is significantly quieter than its diesel powered equivalent. Capable of lifting up to 5,700 lbs. (2,600kg), the SR5719E reaches a maximum lifting height of up to 19 ft. (5.79m), and with its compact dimensions and high-grip, non-marking tires can easily navigate confined spaces both inside and out.

The Snorkel range of lithium-ion battery powered lifts also includes five compact rough terrain scissor lifts, two Speed Level sigma lifts, and an articulated boom lift, the Snorkel A46JRTE. All models are designed for rough terrain applications with powerful 4-wheel drive, but can also be utilized for interior work thanks to zero emissions and low noise. 

Alongside the SR5719E, Snorkel will be showcasing some its battery-electric slab models, including the Snorkel TM16E telescopic mast lift and the S3219E and S3226E electric slab scissor lifts. The S3219E on display at the show is the 10,000th Snorkel S3219E electric slab scissor lift produced at its Elwood, Kansas manufacturing facility in December 2021.

Other popular models at the show will be the Snorkel 460SJ diesel-powered mid-size telescopic boom lift, fitted with a Kubota 24.9hp engine as well as a Snorkel UL40 push-around mast lift.

In celebration of the California Rental Association’s Diamond Jubilee, Snorkel will be giving away a S3006P push-around scissor lift at the CRA Rental Rally. Visitors to the Snorkel booth can drop their business card into the entry box before 12 noon on Wednesday, 26th January 2020.  The prize draw will take place at the show at 1:45pm on Wednesday, 26th January 2020. Entrants must be present at the drawing to win. *Terms and conditions apply, full details available on request.

Visit Snorkel at booth #513 at the 2022 CRA Rental Rally in Las Vegas on January 25th – 26th, 2022.

8135.post_title: Xtreme & Snorkel Take It To 110% At World Of Concrete 2022
8135.post_content:
Xtreme Manufacturing and Snorkel return to the new Diamond Lot at Las Vegas Convention Center today for World of Concrete 2022.

With a prime location at the front of the Diamond Lot, Xtreme Manufacturing, along with sister company, Snorkel, has gone big with a 10,800 sq. ft. (1,003sqm) space, featuring a booth structure by Xtreme Cubes with upper viewing deck. The companies are highlighting the durability and robustness of their products with their “110% Outwork All Others” campaign at the show.

Built to handle the toughest of jobs, with a focus on safety, productivity and serviceability, Xtreme offers the largest selection of high capacity telehandlers in North America. Xtreme is showcasing its extended reach at the 2022 show with a number of models from its product range, including two of the world’s tallest fixed chassis telehandlers, the Xtreme XR1585-C and Xtreme XR1570-C.

Weighing 65,500 lbs. (29,710kg), the XR1585-C is 102 in. (2.59m) wide with a stowed height of 10 ft. 1 in. (3.07m) and a turning radius of 16 ft. 8 in. (5.1m). This industry-leading telehandler offers a forward reach of 67 ft. (20.4m) and a lift capacity of 15,000 lbs. (6,803kg).

Xtreme is also highlighting its popular Xtreme XR1255-B model which is being upgraded in 2022 to utilize Xtreme’s latest chassis design. With improved specifications and increased commonality with other Xtreme B-class and C-class models, the upgraded XR1255-B will be displayed for the first time at World of Concrete 2022.

Other models on display by Xtreme will include the XR619-A, XR843-B, XR1055-B fitted with Xtreme’s award-winning coordinated motion feature, XR1147-B, XR2045-C, XR3034-D and XR4030-E.

Snorkel will be highlighting its two new large deck, rough terrain construction scissor lift families. The Snorkel S9043RT represents the high capacity family, reaching a maximum working height of 49 ft. (15.1m) and is capable of lifting a platform capacity of up to 1,500 lbs. (680kg). The S9043RT on display at the show is powered by a Kubota 1605 dual fuel engine, which is offered as an option.

Showcasing the new ultra-high capacity family, the Snorkel S9043RT-HC also reaches a maximum working height of 49 ft. (15.1m), but can lift up to 3,500 lbs. (1,587kg), and comes with a full-size pallet gate for safer and easier loading of materials into the platform.

Exceeding the platform dimensions of leading competitors, Snorkel’s large deck construction scissors feature a platform that is approximately 20 percent wider and 4 percent longer. With dual extension decks that are 6 percent longer than the industry standard, the maximum available platform size totals 22 ft. x 7 ft. 6 in. (6.7m x 2.3m) when fully extended.

Also at the show, the fully electric Snorkel SR5719E compact rough terrain telehandler represents Snorkel’s growing range of zero emission alternatives to traditional internal combustion lifts. Other Snorkel models on the booth include the Snorkel 660SJ telescopic boom lift fitted with an optional award-winning pressure washing package designed for masonry cleaning, a Snorkel 460SJ with 24.9hp Kubota engine, and the S3970BE bi-energy compact rough terrain scissor lift.

Visit Xtreme Manufacturing and Snorkel at booth #D200 in the Diamond Lot at World of Concrete 2022.

8209.post_title: Fifty-Three Snorkel™ Electric Scissor Lifts For Rentem®
8209.post_content:
Nuremberg based rental company, rentem® has taken delivery of fifty-three custom-painted Snorkel™ electric slab scissor lifts.

This most recent order includes Snorkel S3215E, S3219E, S3226E, S4726E, S4732E models, as well as Snorkel’s new S4740E electric scissor lifts. The units were manufactured at Snorkel’s facility in the United Kingdom and finished with Snorkel’s industry-leading dual coat powder paint in rentem’s lime green special paint colour. The order was placed by rentem® with Ahern Deutschland in August 2021, and all fifty-three units were delivered on the agreed date in rental ready condition, equipped with rentem decals and with Trackunit™ telematics installed.

Founded in 2017, rentem® GmbH operates a fleet of more than 15,000 pieces of general and specialty construction equipment and mobile elevating work platforms which they rent to tradespeople, contractors and the logistics sector, including accessories and trained operator personnel. rentem® is a one-stop solution for the selection and rental of large construction equipment and supports and delivers to projects throughout Europe. With an extensive network of partner companies, rentem® guarantees availability and fast delivery of the required equipment, anytime and anywhere. They utilize digital technology to improve the efficiency and ease of handling large and complex projects for their customers.

In early 2020, rentem® placed their first order with Ahern Deutschland GmbH for several Snorkel scissor lifts, material lifts and the compact and lightweight Snorkel S3010E’s that were available for immediate delivery from their warehouse in Weyerbusch in the Westerwald region.  This was the beginning of the cooperation between the companies that was further strengthened during an in-person meeting between two of the Managing Directors of rentem®, Jona Meier and Jens Krause, and Ahern Family of Companies owner, Don F. Ahern, and Snorkel CEO, Matthew Elvin during CONEXPO-CON/AGG 2020 in Las Vegas, Nevada.  Since then, rentem® has invested in more than 80 Snorkel lifts, including 66 units purchased during 2021.

rentem® Managing Directors’ Jona Meier and Jens Krause with Ahern Deutschland sales representative, Jürgen Müller, on the handover of the 53 electric slab scissor lifts

Speaking of their decision to invest in Snorkel products, Jona Meier, said, “We were looking for a new supplier who - like us - focuses on the customer. We were quickly impressed by the experience that Don Ahern brings to product design through his vast knowledge of the rental sector, and are confident that this design concept will accelerate our growth enormously. By investing in sustainably designed products, we will need significantly less effort with maintenance and repairs, from which our customers will of course also benefit greatly!”

Jens Krause added, “The fact that Ahern Deutschland also keeps many machines in stock, which we can quickly have delivered for our short-term needs supports our belief that we have found an outstanding supplier. We also like that Snorkel focuses on using quality components in their production to maximize uptime of the equipment, which is critical in the rental industry. And last but not least, the scissor lifts that have now been delivered are a new league in terms of quality.”

This most recent order was taken by Jürgen Müller, Sales Representative for Ahern Deutschland in Bavaria and Austria. “I am very happy to work with rentem® and enjoy our partnership. We share the same values which works very well.”

Bernhard Kahn, Managing Director at Ahern Deutschland added, “When Don Ahern became the majority stakeholder in Snorkel in October 2013, one of the first projects that he focused on was to redesign the electric scissor lift family. Designed utilizing his years of rental experience, the new family of electric scissor lifts that launched in February 2015 boasted many innovative design features that not only reduced the risk of damage and loss while on rental, but also minimized downtime and service and maintenance, while delivering a long-working life.”

“We are pleased that with rentem® we have found a customer who appreciates this concept and sees the benefit of their investment within their daily operations.”

For more information on rentem®, please visit www.rentem.de.

8226.post_title: Snorkel Elwood Facility Celebrates 10,000 S3219E Scissor Lifts
8226.post_content:
Snorkel is celebrating the production of its 10,000th Snorkel S3219E electric slab scissor lift at its assembly facility in Elwood, Kansas.

The Snorkel S3219E was introduced in February 2015 as the first model in a completely redesigned family of electric slab scissor lifts for the company. Designed and engineered in Elwood, Kansas, the company today completed the 10,000th unit as it left the assembly line and passed its final quality checks.
The occasion was celebrated with a facility-wide luncheon for all employees. The event was also attended by company executives, Don Ahern, owner, Matthew Elvin, CEO, Elwood facility president, David Smith, and Senior Vice President of Sales for North America, Robby Hagan, along with representatives from local vendors who supply components for the Snorkel S3219E.

Speaking from the event, Don Ahern, said, “This is a proud moment for Snorkel, and particularly the Elwood facility who have historically been known for the production of boom lifts. When we redesigned the electric slab scissor range back in 2014, we really focused on making them rental tough, so to be producing the 10,000th unit here today is testament that these products are fulfilling the needs of our customers.”

The Snorkel S3219E is a 19 ft. (5.79m) electric slab scissor lift which measures 32 in. (0.81m) wide. While Snorkel is highlighting the production of the 10,000th unit from its Elwood facility, the company has produced almost 16,000 units worldwide to date. A globally popular product, Snorkel manufactures the S3219E in four of its manufacturing facilities around the world.

During his speech at the luncheon David Smith, President of Snorkel’s Elwood facility, said, “I would like to congratulate our team here at Elwood facility on reaching this impressive milestone. I would also like to thank our vendors for their continued support. This is a great accomplishment which is truly a team effort.”

The completed 10,000th unit was displayed at the luncheon in a custom decal livery, and will be transferred to Henderson, Nevada in the coming weeks to be displayed at the company’s showroom at their global corporate headquarters.

8273.post_title: First Snorkel Outdoor-Rated Low Level Scissors Delivered To APL
8273.post_content:
Snorkel™ is excited to announce that it has commenced production of its new outdoor-rated push-around mini scissor lift, the S3210P, at its Vigo Center assembly facility in the U.K., and Snorkel UK has delivered the first eight units to U.K. rental company, APL.

Shown as a prototype at CONEXPO-CON/AGG 2020, the Snorkel S3210P is designed for low-level work at height in outdoor slab applications or indoor areas which have a wind loading, such as during the early phases of a construction build where windows or doors may not yet be installed. Measuring 32 in. (0.81m) wide, the S3210P is an outdoor-rated version of the popular Snorkel S3010P push-around mini scissor lift, with a maximum working height of 15 ft. 10 in. (5.0m), a lifting capacity of 529 lbs. (240kg), yet weighs just 1,036 lbs. (470kg).

Developed in response to customer demand, the Snorkel S3210P offers the same easy operation and serviceability as the indoor-rated unit, yet is rated up to a maximum wind speed of 28 mph (12.5m/s). Equipped with an auto-brake system as standard to prevent movement when the lift is raised, the S3210P can be easily pushed when stowed between work areas and carried in a passenger elevator. With saloon-door style entry gates, non-marking casters and simple push-button controls as standard, the Snorkel S3210P is built tough for a long working life in construction, rental and maintenance environments.

 

The S3210P entered production in November 2021 with the first eight units were delivered to APL in early December as part of a larger investment in low-level access. The total order also included ten Snorkel S3010P indoor-rated push-around scissor lifts and ten Snorkel S3010E self-propelled mini scissor lifts. The units were handed over to APL by Jon Plaskitt, area sales manager for Snorkel UK.

Headquartered in Leigh, Greater Manchester in the U.K., with additional locations in Carlisle and Newcastle, APL are a leading privately-owned single source MEWP rental company with more than 800 aerial units in their fleet. They have more than 30 years of industry experience and operate their own transport fleet. They have expanded the business with a ‘Super Fleet’ division specializing in the largest MEWP models and offer a range of services to MEWP owners, including LOLER inspections.

Phil Wong, Finance Director of APL explained their decision to invest in the Snorkel S3210P, “Low level access continues to grow in popularity with various trades now preferring these units over traditional products such as ladders and scaffold towers. However, we have come across multiple occurrences where a push-around scissor lift would be the ideal piece of equipment for the job but we have not been able to specify them due to wind loads. We were excited to see Snorkel introduce this outdoor-rated version and expect them to become popular with our customers who span a wide range of industries.”

 

Matthew Elvin, CEO, Snorkel, said, “The Snorkel S3210P combines all of the safety and productivity benefits of our indoor-rated models with the benefit of being able to use it outdoors or in areas with a wind loading. This ultimately means that the lift could be rented to jobsites for a greater proportion of the project or used in new outdoor applications.”

“I would like to extend my thanks to APL for their recent investment and continued business. We are confident that these new models will be well received by their customers.”

Snorkel offers one of the largest ranges of low-level access solutions in the industry with five low level scissor models now available with working heights up to 15 ft. 10 in. (5.0m).

For more information on the Snorkel S3210P, please visit www.snorkellifts.com/s3210p, and for more on APL, please visit www.aerialplatforms.co.uk.

8319.post_title: Leading The Charge: Briggs Equipment Invest In Snorkel Lithium Speed Levels
8319.post_content:
Briggs Equipment have become the first company in Ireland to invest in Snorkel’s zero emission lithium-ion powered Speed Level lifts.

The company took delivery of two electric Snorkel Speed Levels at their Dublin depot in early November from Ahern Ireland. Introduced in November 2019, the Snorkel SL26RTE and SL30RTE have powerful four-wheel drive capabilities and are able to self-level and drive at full height on compound slopes without the need for outriggers, yet are zero emission and are significantly quieter than the diesel equivalents.

The Snorkel SL26RTE delivers a maximum platform height of 8.0m, a lift capacity of 680kg and a spacious 1.72m x 4.6m platform with the 0.91m roll-out deck extension deployed. The larger Snorkel SL30RTE can reach a maximum platform height of 9.0m, lifting a maximum platform capacity of 590kg, and has a fixed platform of 1.72m x 4.23m

Both models come equipped as standard with 11.5kW Li-ion batteries with integrated battery management (BMS) systems. This standard two battery pack system has been proven to deliver at least an eight-hour shift on a single charge, and in some cases, up to one week between charges, subject to usage. Designed for outdoor applications, the powerful and efficient AC electric motor creates efficiencies in the hydraulic drive system with higher torque than a diesel engine, which in turn provides improved gradeability and enhanced performance on rough terrain than traditional combustion lifts.

Manufactured by Snorkel in the U.K., the SL26RTE and SL30RTE were available from Ahern Ireland’s inventory in Rathcoole for fast delivery, and Briggs Equipment were able to put the units out on hire almost immediately. The SL26RTE was deployed in its first job on a retail park being used to lift workers to clean building facades. The customer was very pleased with the performance of the unit, especially the Speed Level’s capability to be driven at full height while positioned on the pavement.

David Roddy (left) with Martin Masterson of Briggs Equipment in the Snorkel SL30RTE

Martin Masterson, Short Term Hire Manager at Briggs Equipment in Dublin, said, “We are really impressed with the two electric Snorkel Speed Level’s. We are finding many benefits to the unique design of the Speed Level in terms of its ability to be driven at full height unlike a comparative rough terrain scissor lift, and our customers, depot team and delivery drivers are also appreciating the clean and quiet operation of these electric lifts.”

“As a leading hire company, we recognize the importance of embracing cleaner equipment in our fleet and are delighted to be the first company in Ireland to invest in the electric Speed Level and Snorkel’s lithium-ion solution. The machines have seamlessly integrated into our fleet and the feedback so far has been really positive. I would like to thank Ahern Ireland for all of their support with this order.”

David Roddy, Sales Director at Ahern Ireland, added, “It is great to see Briggs Equipment taking the first step into zero emission powered access alternatives, and we sincerely thank them for their trust in Ahern Ireland and Snorkel with this order. We are confident in the performance of our lithium-ion battery solution and we are thrilled that Briggs Equipment is already receiving positive feedback from their team and customers.”

With two locations, in Dublin and Lisburn, Briggs Equipment provides equipment sales, hire, service and training across the island of Ireland. Briggs Equipment is part of Briggs International, which is the world’s largest global distributor of Hyster material handling equipment, and is owned by parent company, Sammons Enterprises In., one of the world’s largest privately-owned companies.

For more information on Briggs Equipment please visit www.briggsequipment.ie.

This standard two battery pack system has been proven to deliver at least an eight-hour shift on a single charge, and in some cases, up to one week between charges, subject to usage. Designed for outdoor applications, the powerful and efficient AC electric motor creates efficiencies in the hydraulic drive system with higher torque than a diesel engine, which in turn provides improved gradeability and enhanced performance on rough terrain than traditional combustion lifts.

Manufactured by Snorkel in the U.K., the SL26RTE and SL30RTE were available from Ahern Ireland’s inventory in Rathcoole for fast delivery, and Briggs Equipment were able to put the units out on hire almost immediately. The SL26RTE was deployed in its first job on a retail park being used to lift workers to clean building facades. The customer was very pleased with the performance of the unit, especially the Speed Level’s capability to be driven at full height while positioned on the pavement.

David Roddy (left) with Martin Masterson of Briggs Equipment in the Snorkel SL30RTE

Martin Masterson, Short Term Hire Manager at Briggs Equipment in Dublin, said, “We are really impressed with the two electric Snorkel Speed Level’s. We are finding many benefits to the unique design of the Speed Level in terms of its ability to be driven at full height unlike a comparative rough terrain scissor lift, and our customers, depot team and delivery drivers are also appreciating the clean and quiet operation of these electric lifts.”

“As a leading hire company, we recognize the importance of embracing cleaner equipment in our fleet and are delighted to be the first company in Ireland to invest in the electric Speed Level and Snorkel’s lithium-ion solution. The machines have seamlessly integrated into our fleet and the feedback so far has been really positive. I would like to thank Ahern Ireland for all of their support with this order.”

David Roddy, Sales Director at Ahern Ireland, added, “It is great to see Briggs Equipment taking the first step into zero emission powered access alternatives, and we sincerely thank them for their trust in Ahern Ireland and Snorkel with this order. We are confident in the performance of our lithium-ion battery solution and we are thrilled that Briggs Equipment is already receiving positive feedback from their team and customers.”

With two locations, in Dublin and Lisburn, Briggs Equipment provides equipment sales, hire, service and training across the island of Ireland. Briggs Equipment is part of Briggs International, which is the world’s largest global distributor of Hyster material handling equipment, and is owned by parent company, Sammons Enterprises In., one of the world’s largest privately-owned companies.

For more information on Briggs Equipment please visit www.briggsequipment.ie.

8393.post_title: Snorkel UK Hosts Access Alliance Quarterly Meeting
8393.post_content:
Snorkel UK was pleased to host the Access Alliance during their recent meeting that was held in Newcastle-upon-Tyne on Wednesday 13th October.

The meeting was held in private in central Newcastle, following a welcome and introduction from Snorkel UK sales representative, Scott Holtby. After the close of the meeting, and lunch, the Snorkel UK sales team delivered a presentation to the group focused on new products and financing solutions offered by Snorkel.

This was followed by a visit to Snorkel’s manufacturing facility in Washington, Tyne & Wear, where the Access Alliance members were given a full facility tour and the opportunity to see and test drive a wide of Snorkel equipment, including the new line of lithium-electric powered models. The facility visit was followed by a dinner hosted by Snorkel UK in central Newcastle.

Andrew Fishburn, Managing Director of Snorkel UK and Vice President of Strategic Accounts – EMEA for Snorkel, said, “We were once again delighted to welcome the Access Alliance to Vigo Centre and host their quarterly meeting. This was particularly special as it was the first time since early 2020 that we have been able to host a group event like this, and there was a real enthusiasm from everyone who participated.”

“I would like to take this opportunity to thank the Access Alliance for this opportunity and we hope that everyone had an enjoyable time and benefitted from the visit.”

During the meeting, George Marriott, managing director of Access Plus was appointed chairman of Access Alliance, replacing Michelle Warren of Warren Access who served in the role for the past two years.

Of the event, George Marriott said, “I would like to thank Snorkel UK for hosting Access Alliance. It was really interesting to learn more about Snorkel’s lithium-electric products and take a tour of the manufacturing facility.”

The Access Alliance is a collaboration of some of the UK and Ireland’s strongest independently owned regional powered access sales and rental companies, who offer a consistent level of service and quality of equipment across the UK. 

For more information on The Access Alliance visit www.theaccessalliance.co.uk.

8408.post_content:
Loxam Denmark has invested in eight Snorkel lithium compact rough terrain scissors from Ahern Denmark.

The order included four Snorkel S3370RTE and four Snorkel S3970RTE, which were manufactured by Snorkel in the U.K., and feature Loxam’s distinctive red and grey livery in a long-lasting dual-coat powder paint finish.

The scissor lifts were delivered to Ahern Denmark in early September, with the first two machines being taken to a Loxam Denmark sales meeting where they were presented to branch managers and sales personnel as a product introduction. The remaining six units have been delivered to Loxam branches across Denmark.

The Snorkel S3370RTE is capable of lifting up to 1,000 lbs. (454kg) to a working height of up to 39 ft. (12m), while the taller S3970RTE can reaching up to 45 ft. (13.8m), with a platform capacity of 771 lbs. (350kg). Both models feature high grip, non-marking tires for indoor/outdoor use, and have powerful four-wheel drive capabilities with 35% gradeability and an oscillating axle. Four auto-leveling stabilizers come as standard, which benefit from Snorkel’s inverted leg design that protects the cylinder rod from damage and debris, and can level up to 6 degrees front-to-rear, and 10 degrees side-to-side.

Completely zero emissions, the S3370RTE and S3970RTE both come with two 111Ah (5.75kWh) maintenance-free battery packs with built-in battery management systems (BMS) as standard. In both test conditions and real-life applications, the standard two battery pack system has been proven to deliver at least an eight-hour shift on a single charge, and in some cases, up to one week between charges, subject to usage.

Designed for outdoor applications, a powerful and efficient AC electric motor creates efficiencies in the hydraulic drive system with higher torque than a diesel engine, which in turn provides improved gradeability and enhanced performance on rough terrain than traditional combustion scissor lifts. The electric motor also delivers up to 62% less jobsite noise than the diesel equivalent, enabling the lifts to be used indoors or in work environments with noise regulations, and with no engine fan, dust generation is reduced for safer and cleaner operation in low emission zones and green cities.

With minimal battery and electrical system maintenance required, servicing costs are reduced by up to 93% when compared to an engine, while also eliminating the costs and risks of waste oil and filter disposal.

On the recent investment in Snorkel’s lithium technology, Loxam Denmark’s Technical Director, Frank Larsen said, “Development in zero emissions and noise reduction make it essential to look at lithium-ion technology in high-reach equipment. Loxam Denmark is looking forward to sending these machines into the Danish rental market.”

Henrik Skibsted, General Manager, Ahern Denmark said, “We are delighted that Loxam Denmark made the decision to invest in Snorkel’s lithium-electric compact rough terrain scissor lifts, and we are confident that they will be very positively received by the rental branches and their customers. I would like to thank Frank and team for their trust in Ahern Denmark and Snorkel with this order and we look forward to working with them in future.”

For more information on Loxam Denmark, please visit www.loxam.dk.

8414.post_title: Snorkel Raises The Stakes As The ARA Show Returns To Las Vegas
8414.post_content:
Celebrating the return of The ARA Show to Las Vegas, Snorkel™ is upping the stakes with its largest-ever display at the annual trade show for the North American rental industry.

With two booths, totaling more than 6,400 sq. ft. (595sqm) of exhibit space, Snorkel has a large indoor display in the Construction Hall, plus another large booth at the entrance to the outdoor Bronze Lot, where its industry-leading Snorkel 2100SJ telescopic boom lift will be showcased to the rental sector for the first time.

Raising the Standard

One of the world’s largest self-propelled aerial lifts, the Snorkel 2100SJ was originally previewed at CONEXPO-CON/AGG in March 2020. The latest model on display at The ARA Show includes a number of upgrades, including greater forward reach, now 115 ft. (35.1m), as well as improved ground clearance and remote secondary controls, enabling the operator to freely move around the platform and face the working area when positioning at height.

The Snorkel 2100SJ delivers a maximum working height of 216 ft. (66.0m), has a 30 ft. (9.1m) jib boom and an industry-leading working envelope volume of 7.11 million ft3 (0.2 million m³). Benefitting from five-steering modes, including lateral steer which enables the lift to be driven side-to-side along a building with the wheels in a 90° position, the Snorkel 2100SJ is able to navigate confined spaces with a best-in-class 8 ft. 6 in. (2.6m) inside turning radius with the axles extended.

It also has multiple patent-pending design features, including a secondary control pendant in the platform so that the operator can face the direction of travel for precise positioning at height, as well as an innovative axle extension design where the wheels ‘drive’ the axles into position to eliminate tire scrub and provide a smoother extension experience than other systems on the market.

Alongside the Snorkel 2100SJ on the outdoor booth, Snorkel is highlighting its two new large deck, rough terrain construction scissor lift families. The Snorkel S9043RT represents the high capacity family, reaching a maximum working height of 49 ft. (15.1m) and capable of lifting a platform capacity of up to 1,500 lbs. (680kg). Showcasing the new ultra-high capacity family, the Snorkel S9043RT-HC also reaches a maximum working height of 49 ft. (15.1m), but can lift up to 3,500 lbs. (1,587kg). The Snorkel 660SJ telescopic boom lift fitted with an optional pressure washing package completes the 2,400 sq. ft. (223sqm) outdoor booth.

New Products & New Features

On its indoor booth, Snorkel is highlighting its family of nine lithium-electric powered alternatives to diesel powered models to the North American rental industry. The lithium-electric Snorkel SL26RTE Speed Level takes pride of place displayed on ramps, and sits alongside the worlds-first lithium-electric compact rough terrain telehandler, the Snorkel SR5719E.

Recently upgraded to feature increased lifting capacities utilizing a dual envelope, the Snorkel 460SJ mid-size telescopic boom lift will be shown, as well as the Snorkel S4740E electric slab scissor lift which is now in full production.

Snorkel is also using the show as a global launchpad for its new telematics offering, Snorkel OnSite™. Powered by Trackunit®, Snorkel OnSite is a full-service telematics offering that is available on most current Snorkel mobile elevating work platforms and telehandlers, which are designed to be telematics-ready featuring a compatible connection for the telematics module. Visitors to the Snorkel booths will be able to find out more about the solution, and will be invited to celebrate the launch by attending a Snorkel and Trackunit jointly-hosted reception on Tuesday evening.

Three for FREE

Celebrating the return to Las Vegas, Snorkel is giving show attendees the chance to win big, without the need to visit a casino. In its largest equipment giveaway yet, three Snorkel S3006P push around scissor lifts will be gifted to booth visitors during the show. A winner will be drawn each day, with the prize draw taking place live on the Snorkel indoor booth and also streamed on social media. Any visitor who requests a quotation during the show from a Snorkel sales representative will be automatically entered to win.

A Celebration of an Industry Pioneer

Snorkel is also proud to celebrate the induction of company owner, Don F. Ahern, into the ARA Rental Hall of Fame during the The ARA Show 2021. The Snorkel team are celebrating with a special booth display recognizing some of Don’s many achievements in the rental and manufacturing industries.

Visit Snorkel at Indoor Booth #2033 in the Construction Area, South Hall and Outdoors at Booth #OT101 in the Bronze Lot at the Las Vegas Convention Center from October 18 – 20, 2021.

8453.post_title: Snorkel OnSite™ Telematics Solution Now Available
8453.post_content:
Henderson, NV, USA (18th October 2021) Snorkel™ is very pleased to announce the global launch of its new telematics offering, Snorkel OnSite™ today at The ARA Show 2021.

Powered by Trackunit®, Snorkel OnSite is a full-service telematics offering that is available on most current Snorkel mobile elevating work platforms and telehandlers, many of which are now telematics-ready featuring a compatible connection for the telematics module.

Available globally, Snorkel OnSite can be optioned at the time of ordering for factory-install, or for field-installation by an authorized Snorkel dealer or service center. Snorkel offers a choice of telematics subscriptions, including a Direct Data and API package that can feed data from Snorkel lifts directly into a customer’s existing telematics dashboard, as well as a Data and Dashboard package which includes access to a Trackunit branded dashboard where a customer can access Snorkel machine data, as well as feed in other products from other brands.

Subscription packages are available in a choice of either 24-months or 60-months, and an optional access keypad with RFID capabilities is available. The type of data that can be accessed in Snorkel products is based on whether the unit is CAN bus or Non-CAN bus, but generally includes key information such as the machine status (on/off), machine hours, the machine’s physical location, and the battery charge level.

Access to real-time information provides opportunity for improved product support. Snorkel has trained its global product support teams and distribution network on the Trackunit solution, enabling them to provide faster and more accurate troubleshooting support remotely.

"Trackunit is one of the leading telematics providers for our industry, and we are very pleased to have partnered with them to develop this solution for our customers” said Matthew Elvin, CEO, Xtreme Manufacturing & Snorkel. “In line with our keep it simple approach, we focused on making it easy for our customers to access all of their fleet data in one place, either through the Trackunit dashboard, or by using API’s to feed the data into their existing telematics tools. This maximizes the usability of the data to the customer, as they can see everything in one place.”

“We are proud to work with an industry-leading OEM in bringing this technology to the market. Snorkel has taken a truly customer-centric approach to the data that their customers will find value in. Leveraging the Trackunit ecosystem, they enable customers to drive useful insights back into their organizations.” said Jeffrey Cohen, President, Trackunit.

Trackunit is a provider of fleet management solutions to the global construction equipment industry. They collect and analyze machine data in real-time to deliver actionable, proactive and predictive information, empowering customers with data-driven foresight. Headquartered in Denmark, Chicago, IL and Singapore, and with subsidiaries in Sweden, Norway, France, Holland, Germany, UK, Australia and Japan, Trackunit supports its customers globally. Trackunit were selected as the telematics program partner for the Ahern Family of Companies in June 2020.

For more information on Snorkel OnSite telematics, please visit www.snorkellifts.com/onsite. Snorkel and Trackunit are celebrating the launch with a jointly hosted reception for customers on Tuesday, October 19th.

8467.post_content:
For its second annual awards, the World of Safety & Health Asia (WSHAsia) Awards recognized the Snorkel 2100SJ telescopic boom lift and S9070RT-HC ultra-capacity rough terrain scissor lift for their innovations in safety.

The WSHAsia Award 2021 honors the innovation of the safety sector in solutions that can improve safety and health in the workplace. Each submission is reviewed by a panel of three judges from the health and safety sector. The awards were announced on September 30, 2021,during a virtual award ceremony.

The WSHAsia Awards featured three categories this year – Safety, Health and Technology. Under the Safety category, the Snorkel 2100SJ and S9070RT-HC were both recognized for their safety features to protect workers while at height

For more information about WSHAsia Awards, visit wshasia.com

8479.post_title: Snorkel Upgrades Mid-Size Telescopic Boom Line With Higher Lift Capacities
8479.post_content:
Snorkel™, a leading global manufacturer of mobile elevating work platforms is pleased to announce the release of its upgraded line of mid-sized telescopic boom lifts.

All Snorkel mid-size telescopic boom lift models will feature a new dual envelope design as standard, delivering higher lifting capacities on all six models. The Snorkel 400S, 460SJ, 600S, 660SJ and 600S and 660SJ All-Terrain have been fitted with a newly designed, globally-compliant jib boom. Measuring 5 ft. 6 in. (1.67m), the new jib boom reduces the stowed length of the unit for ease of transportation, while enabling higher lifting capacities.

All six upgraded models will now deliver a maximum platform capacity of 1,000 lbs. (454kg) with a restricted working envelope and 600 lbs. (272kg) unrestricted. Developed in response to customer demand, the higher lifting capacities enable workers to carry additional tools and materials to the work area, increasing jobsite productivity. The latest models also feature upgraded controls with a visual indicator showing the operator which capacity zone they are in, and clearer graphical display for ease of operation.

Matthew Elvin, CEO, Snorkel, said, “We are very pleased to be able to give our customers more capacity and features on already popular models. We know that the increased capacity will be welcomed by our valued customers, and will play a part in delivering enhanced productivity on jobsites around the world.”

The upgraded models are now in production and available to order globally.

8497.post_title: Snorkel 2100SJ Named Boom Lift Of The Year In Movicarga PEM Awards
8497.post_content:
The Snorkel 2100SJ telescopic boom lift has been named the Product of the Year in the Self-Propelled Boom Lift category at the annual Premios Elevacion Movicarga (PEM) Awards.

Organized by Movicarga magazine, the 2021 PEM Awards took place on Thursday, September 23rd in Madrid, Spain attracting more than 320 attendees. In the first award announcement of the evening, the award for the Snorkel 2100SJ was presented to Snorkel CEO, Matthew Elvin, and Enrique Garcia, Managing Director of Ahern Iberica.  Ahern Iberica, the official sales, service and spare parts provider for Snorkel in Spain and Portugal were a Gold level sponsor of the PEM awards.

Speaking from Madrid, Matthew Elvin, said, “It is a great honour to receive this award for the Snorkel 2100SJ, which recognizes the many industry-first features of this new product design.”

For more information on the Movicarga PEM Awards, please visit https://movicarga.com/premios-elevacion-movicarga/.

8509.post_title: Snorkel Launches Its First Lithium-Powered Rough Terrain Boom
8509.post_content:
Snorkel is proud to unveil its ninth model in its lithium-ion battery powered family of rough terrain mobile elevating work platforms and telehandlers.

The new Snorkel A46JRTE makes its global debut today at Vertikal Days exhibition in the U.K., becoming the company’s first lithium powered boom lift. It joins eight other lithium-powered Snorkel models which have been introduced since late 2019, including the SL26RTE and SL30RTE electric Speed Levels, the S2255RTE, S2755RTE, S2770RTE, S3370RTE and S3970RTE electric rough terrain scissor lifts, and the electric SR5719E/SR626E compact rough terrain telehandler.

Utilizing the same lithium-ion battery pack solution as the other mobile elevating work platforms in the family, the A46JRTE offers a true zero emission rough terrain solution, without compromising on the reliability and four-wheel drive capabilities of the diesel equivalent. It comes as standard with three 111Ah (5.75kWh) lithium-ion battery packs, which satisfies many applications, including heavy-use.

The automotive-quality lithium-ion battery packs are produced in the North East of England, and are individually equipped with the latest battery management systems (BMS). Requiring zero maintenance, the battery packs have been tested in climatic chambers between -77°F (-25°C) and +140°F (+60°C), making them suitable for use in most environments.

Depending on usage, Snorkel lithium-powered mobile elevating work platforms are delivering extended duty cycles per charge, when compared to similar models. Based on typical use in rough terrain under test conditions, a single charge can last for more than one week, and in light use on elevation jobs with minimal driving, this increases to more than two weeks on a single charge.

Featuring a powerful AC electric motor, which creates efficiencies in the hydraulic drive system, the Snorkel A46JRTE benefits from higher torque, which results in increased traction and improved rough terrain performance. The electric motor also delivers 62% less jobsite noise and with no engine fan, dust generation is reduced for safer and cleaner operation in low emission zones and green cities. With minimal battery and electrical system maintenance required, servicing costs are reduced by up to 93% when compared to an engine, while also eliminating the costs and risks of waste oil and filter disposal.  Less servicing also reduces the load on service engineers.

The original diesel-powered Snorkel A46JRT is a proven and globally popular articulated boom lift, known for its long working life and exceptional working envelope. Capable of reaching a maximum working height of 52 ft. 11 in (16.3m), the A46JRT has a working outreach of 24 ft. 11 in (7.35m) and benefits from a zero tailswing and 5 ft. (1.5m) jib boom for excellent maneuverability in confined spaces.

The new lithium-powered four-wheel drive A46JRTE expands the A46 family to three models. Snorkel continues to offer the diesel-powered four-wheel drive A46JRT model, as well as its two-wheel drive electric powered A46JE, which is suited to indoor and outdoor work on concrete slab and is popular in industrial applications.

On display for the first time at Vertikal Days, the A46JRTE is shown alongside four other lithium-powered models, the SR626E compact rough terrain telehandler, the SL30RTE Speed Level, and the S2755RTE and S3970RTE compact rough terrain scissor lifts, which is the first time that Snorkel has shown a representative selection of its lithium family in one place.

Speaking from Vertikal Days, Matthew Elvin, CEO, Xtreme Manufacturing & Snorkel, said, “The launch of our first lithium-powered boom lift is an exciting next step in our development of zero emission alternatives to diesel. The compact and mid-size aerial lift and telehandler segment is a sweet spot for electrification, and our lithium-battery technology is proving to be a zero-compromise solution in this product category, delivering zero emissions, reduced noise and equivalent or better performance than the diesel.”

The company is also using the show as a launchpad for its new lithium-focused website at www.snorkelnetzero.com. Designed to aide customers in the switch from diesel to lithium equipment, the site features a range of resources including diesel vs. lithium cost calculators for both rental companies and contractors, as well as frequently asked questions, photos, videos and region-specific information on market drivers and adoption. Snorkel is also offering direct training for its rental customers, to help them educate their customers on the benefits of this new technology.

All nine models in the Snorkel lithium-electric family are now in full production and available to order globally.  For more information on Snorkel, please visit www.snorkellifts.com, or to learn more about the lithium-electric range and benefits, go to www.snorkelnetzero.com. 

Visitors to Vertikal Days can see the lithium-family and try out the lithium cost calculators on the Snorkel UK stand (104/105) on Wednesday 22nd and Thursday 23rd September at the East of England Showground, near Peterborough, U.K.

8529.post_title: Official Grand Opening For Ahern Denmark
8529.post_content:
Ahern Denmark™ marked its launch with an official grand opening event and ribbon cutting ceremony today.

Part of the Ahern International division owned by Don Ahern, Ahern Denmark is the exclusive provider of sales, service and spare parts for Snorkel™ mobile elevating work platforms, telehandlers and material lifts, and DENKA Lift and EuropeLift trailer-mounted lifts for Denmark.

Held at Ahern Denmark’s premises in Vejle, Denmark, the open house-style event attracted attendees including customers, suppliers, media and local officials. With a ‘celebration of Denmark’ theme, guests enjoyed local street food including Danish hotdogs, crepes and roast pork, local live music and an opportunity to tour the 800sqm Ahern Denmark facility and see a range of Snorkel and DENKA Lift products.

Ahern Denmark was formed following Ahern International’s acquisition of the majority of KH Lift ApS on 1st April 2021. It has since invested in growing the team to 12 employees, as well as holding increased new machine and spare parts inventory for faster local customer support, and has put additional service vehicles on the road to provide improved rapid-response technical support to customers across Denmark. The company is also partnering with independent service providers to bolster its customer support.

During the ribbon cutting ceremony, Xtreme Manufacturing and Snorkel CEO, and head of Ahern International global distribution, Matthew Elvin, told attendees about the company’s long-term commitment to the market. “Ahern Denmark is our ninth international distribution business since 2016, focused solely on the supply and support of new high-reach and related equipment. It is our commitment to the Danish market that we are here for the long-term, dedicated to becoming a trusted partner to our rental and end-user customers.”

Also speaking from the event, Henrik Skibsted, General Manager, Ahern Denmark, said “I am extremely grateful to all of our valued customers, suppliers and stakeholders who have supported us with this launch, and we are committed to exceeding expectations in all aspects of our service offering. I would also like to thank Don Ahern, Matthew Elvin and the Ahern International team for their support in opening Ahern Denmark, who have helped us put in place the team and tools to deliver world-class service, which includes fast access to new machines, spare parts and technical support, to our valued and growing customer base.”

The ribbon cutting was performed by the Deputy Mayor of Vejle, Dan Arnløv Jørgensen, who officially declared Ahern Denmark open for business.

8540.post_content:
One of Germany’s oldest mobile elevating work platform rental companies, Stützle-Späth, has invested in twenty-two Snorkel scissor lifts.

The first part of the order was delivered in late July, with Managing Director, Torsten Späth receiving thirteen Snorkel S3219E electric scissor lifts, and four Snorkel S3370RT compact rough terrain scissor lifts in custom yellow paint from Ahern Deutschland sales representative, Tommy Härtig. The lifts were delivered in Snorkel’s custom-branded truck directly to Stützle-Späth’s branch location in Schelklingen in the district of Alb-Donau in Baden-Württemberg, which is situated in the south of Germany between Stuttgart and Munich.

The second part of the order includes four Snorkel S3215L lightweight electric scissor lifts, plus the first German order for the new Snorkel S9070RT-HC high capacity rough terrain construction scissor lift, that was previewed at CONEXPO/CON-AGG 2020.

Established in 1973, the Stützle-Späth company is one of the oldest rental companies in Germany. A family business, they specialize in the rental of high reach access equipment, including insulated and highly insulated and 4-wheel drive equipment. As one of the leading providers of aerial work platforms in Germany, they operate a fleet of more than 300 units, with working heights ranging from 6m to 75m, in a variety of designs and drive options.

Explaining why they chose to place this two-part order with Snorkel, Torsten Späth, said, “We selected Snorkel products based on positive past experiences. The new scissors lifts have well-thought out design features that are ideal for rental applications and are easy to use. This saves time for loading and unloading equipment, as well as reducing the time it takes to familiarize customers on the jobsite.”

“In terms of product quality, we are convinced that Snorkel products are the right choice for our rental fleet, and we are excited to be amongst the first rental companies in Europe to offer the new 23m S9070RT-HC “megadeck” scissor lift.”

Bernhard Kahn, Managing Director at Ahern Deutschland, said, “We would like to thank Stützle-Späth for this order. We are delighted that they are benefiting from some of the rental-focused design features of Snorkel products and look forward to supporting them in future.”

 

For more information on Stützle-Späth, please visit www.stuetzle-spaeth.de.

8556.post_title: Snorkel CEO Presents At ALH Conference 2021
8556.post_content:
Matthew Elvin, Xtreme Manufacturing and Snorkel CEO, addressed the participants of the ALH 2021 Virtual Conference on Tuesday, September 14 with a presentation on the topic of equipment electrification.

Titled “The electrification of telehandlers and high reach equipment with a focus on lithium power”, Matthew discussed the current and future drivers for equipment electrification, as well as taking a look at electric technology developments in the automotive industry and the commitments made by carmakers. He concluded by explaining the reasons behind Snorkel’s decision to utilize lithium-ion battery technology in place of diesel engines, and how the company has overcome some of the challenges to adoption.

Access, Lifts and Handlers magazine who organize the annual ALH Conference had to make a switch to a virtual conference at short notice as Covid cases in the planned host city of Chicago increased in recent weeks, meaning they were unable to hold an in-person event.

 

For more details on the ALH Conference and Access, Lifts & Handlers magazine, please visit https://www.alh-ca.com.

8569.post_title: Sixty Snorkel Booms For U.S. Government
8569.post_content:
Henderson, Nevada, USA (15th September 2021) Snorkel is delighted to announce that it has received an order from equipment sales and service specialist, Alden Equipment, Inc., for sixty Snorkel A46JRT articulated boom lifts.

The order, received in April 2021, will be delivered by Alden Equipment to an undisclosed U.S. Government customer and will be shipped to a number of locations in the U.S. and internationally. The booms are being assembled by Snorkel at their manufacturing facility in Elwood, Kansas.

Founded in 1979, Alden Equipment started out as an equipment repair company before branching out into equipment sales. In 2008, they entered into a long-term GSA contract with the U.S. Government for the international supply of material handling equipment, and in 2015 obtained three long-term DLA HEPP contracts. Located in Amsterdam, New York, they are a trusted provider of forklifts, aerial lifts, batteries and chargers, warehouse equipment and parts and service for customers in all time zones, and are a Government and special projects dealer for Snorkel lifts.

The Snorkel A46JRT is a proven and globally popular articulated boom lift, known for its long working life and exceptional working envelope. Capable of reaching a maximum working height of 52 ft. 11 in (16.3m), the A46JRT has a working outreach of 24 ft. 11 in (7.35m) and benefits from a zero tailswing and 5 ft. (1.5m) jib boom for excellent maneuverability in confined spaces.

Adapted for this order for the U.S. Government, the A46JRT features a new dual-envelope design which provides an unrestricted lifting capacity of 650 lbs. (295kg) which increases to 750 lbs. (340kg) when working within a restricted envelope area. The machines also have updated upper and lower control panels, as well as a new 72 in. x 30 in. (1.82m x 0.76m) aluminum platform with saloon-door style entry gates and high-grip flooring.

 

Equipped for a range of environments and applications, the lifts have been fitted with multiple options including an aircraft package, tow kit, light package, extreme environment package, cold weather package, battery warmer, and power and air lines to the platform. The A46JRT’s are painted in custom colors and feature reflective tape.

Charles Barber, Sales Manager at Alden Equipment secured the Government order, and said, “We are incredibly pleased to secure this initial order for sixty Snorkel A46JRT’s for our U.S. Government customer, which involved a significant year-long bid process. The Snorkel A46JRT is the ideal product for their project, and I would like to express our thanks to Mike Coleman and the Snorkel team for working with us to adapt the lift to meet their exact requirements.”

“We are always proud to deliver quality U.S. manufactured products to the U.S. Government and it has been great to have the opportunity to visit the Elwood facility and see these products at various stages of build on the assembly line.”

David Smith, President, Snorkel’s Elwood facility, “This is a significant volume order for Snorkel A46JRT’s and I speak on behalf of our team in Elwood, Kansas when I say that it gives us tremendous pride to build products that are destined for use for by U.S. Government agencies, on home soil and abroad. I would also like to thank Alden Equipment for their dedication to securing this order which we know takes a lot of time and effort from their side.”

For more information on Alden Equipment, Inc., please visit www.aldenequipment.com.

8591.post_title: Snorkel S4740E Makes European Debut At Platformers’ Days
8591.post_content:
Snorkel™ is pleased to announce that its latest electric slab scissor model has made its European debut at Platformers’ Days in Germany.

Launched at CONEXPO-CON/AGG 2020, the Snorkel S4740E entered full production in North America in January 2021, with European production at Snorkel’s manufacturing facility in the U.K. commencing earlier this month.

The S4740E is the largest electric slab scissor lift offered by Snorkel, with a maximum working height of 45 ft. 5 in. (14.0m), measuring just 47 in. (1.19m) wide. Ideal for working in tilt-up warehouse spaces and confined high-rise indoor spaces, the Snorkel S4740E is the company’s first lift to be offered with a choice of either hydraulic or electric drive.

Weighing 6,825 lbs. (3,100kg), the S4740E shares the same features and benefits of Snorkel’s existing electric slab scissor lift family, including saloon-door style entry gates, “inside-out” access to key components for easy servicing, and a fixed upper control box with integrated power outlets. 

The first UK-built S4740E is currently on display at Platformers’ Days, on Ahern Deutschland’s indoor stand, and is now available to order globally. For more information on the Snorkel S4740E, please visit www.snorkellifts.com, and for more on Ahern Deutschland, please visit www.aherndeutschland.de.

Visitors to Platformers’ Days can find Ahern Deutschland displaying a large selection of Snorkel products in the indoor hall at Stand A140 and in the outdoor area at Stand H250 on Friday, September 10th and Saturday, September 11th at the show’s new location in Messe Karlsruhe. More information on Platformers’ Days can be found at www.platformers-days.de.

8603.post_content:
Droitwich-based Platform Hire have become the first U.K. hire company to add lithium-ion battery powered Snorkel S3970RTE compact rough terrain scissor lifts to their fleet.

Leading the hire industry towards the adoption of cleaner, more environmentally-friendly equipment, Platform Hire are the first hire company in the U.K. to offer these zero-emission scissor lifts to their customers. Built in the U.K. at Snorkel’s facility in Washington, Tyne and Wear, and utilizing British manufactured lithium-ion batteries, the first two Snorkel S3970RTE’s were recently delivered to Platform Hire and have been immediately deployed in their rental fleet. The decision to purchase the lifts was made after a successful demonstration in April by Snorkel UK Area Sales Manager, Scott Holtby, and is the first part of a larger order.

The Snorkel S3970RTE is the largest model in a new range of lithium-ion battery powered compact rough terrain scissor lifts. Reaching a maximum working height of up to 13.8m, the S3970RTE has a platform capacity of 350kg, and can be driven at full height. Measuring just 1.8m wide, this scissor lift can access confined spaces, yet features a spacious platform that can be extended up to 1.6m x 4.0m, and is available with non-marking, high grip tyres for indoor/outdoor use.

Powered by a 52V system incorporating two 5.75kWh lithium-ion batteries with integrated battery management systems, the S3970RTE is completely zero emission, yet delivers improved rough terrain performance over the diesel equivalent, thanks to additional power and torque via an AC electric motor and four-wheel drive hydraulic transmission.

A high frequency 50A on-board smart charger enables the lift to be fully recharged in up to 8 hours, but also allows for top-up charging such as during a break or shift changes. Depending on the application and usage, the S3970RTE can complete a full day’s work on a single charge, and in some cases up to a full week. For heavier duty cycles or projects that require long-distance driving, the lift can be optioned with an additional 5.75kWh battery.

With more than 13 years’ experience, Platform Hire are a leading specialist provider of mobile elevating work platforms, offering rentals, sales, training and more to their customer base. With their head office in Droitwich in the West Midlands and coverage provided nationally, Platform Hire also operate Platform Hire Racing in the British Superbikes championship, and provide aerial equipment to many race tracks around the U.K.

On the decision to be the first U.K. hire company to add Snorkel lithium-ion powered compact rough terrain scissor lifts to their fleet, Dave Williams, Managing Director of Platform Hire, said, “I would like to thank Scott Holtby for working together with us on this project and enabling Platform Hire to be the first company in the country to offer these market-leading machines. The focus on reducing emissions and achieving net zero targets is increasing across the U.K., and we are seeing more large construction contractors discussing the need for zero and low emission equipment solutions. As a specialist in aerial equipment, we continuously monitor product developments and have been evaluating the new zero emission models for some time.”

“We were impressed by the quality and reliability of the Snorkel lithium-ion battery solution during our trials. The fact that our customers can meet both emissions and noise regulations with a powerful rough terrain unit, without any compromise in performance when compared to a diesel unit is a real winner.

Additionally, when we calculated the savings in maintenance and fuel, even with a higher upfront purchase price, the return on investment is very attractive and we expect to see these units become very popular with our customers.”

Andrew Fishburn, Managing Director, Snorkel UK, said, “We are delighted to deliver the first two units to Platform Hire, and thank them for taking this first step in bringing this technology to British jobsites. We know that the demand from the larger contractors already exists, and as the products become more widely available, this demand will grow across all types of aerial equipment users.”

Platform Hire are already receiving positive feedback from their customers on the new Snorkel S3970RTE’s. One of their first hires was to an existing customer for heating and air conditioning installation, who said, “The Snorkel S3970RTE was offered to us instead of our usual machines to try out and we were extremely impressed. It meant only hiring the one machine for jobs where we would usually have a diesel machine for outside and a smaller electric machine for inside. After two 12-hour shifts the battery indicated it still had 46% charge left! We have already hired it again since and will be requesting this machine moving forward.”

For more information on Platform Hire, please visit www.platformhire.co.uk.

8619.post_title: Arslift Appointed Snorkel Distributor For Russia
8619.post_content:
Snorkel is very pleased to announce that it has entered into a full-service distribution agreement with Russian rental company, Arslift.

The agreement which commenced on 1st June 2021, appoints Arslift as the official distribution partner for Snorkel in the Russian Federation, to sell all Snorkel products, including mobile elevating work platforms, telehandlers and material lifts into the territory, as well as genuine Snorkel spare parts, and to provide technical service and support to Snorkel customers in the region.

Arslift has already purchased a number of Snorkel lifts which they have been operating within their rental fleet, including ten Snorkel A38E electric articulated boom lifts. They also have multiple units on order including MB26J mast boom lifts, A46JRT articulated boom lifts, and a TL49J towable boom lift.

A specialist mobile elevating work platform rental company and dealer, Arslift operates a fleet of more than 300 self-propelled lifts. Headquartered in the city of Nizhny Novgorod, they have nine locations providing complete coverage across the Russian Federation.

Aleksandr Opolev, Business Development Director at Arslift said, “We have been impressed with the Snorkel products in our fleet, as well as the support from Konstantin and the Snorkel team. As a specialist in this sector, we only partner with brands that we trust and believe in, and it gives me great pleasure to have formed this alliance with Snorkel. We look forward to developing our relationship further and representing them in our great region.”

Konstantin Kuvaldin, Territory Manager for Eastern Europe for Snorkel added, “Arslift have an excellent nationwide footprint and a very strong reputation in the lifting equipment segment, making them a very promising distribution partner. Through the operation of their own rental fleet, they understand the importance of purchasing reliable equipment and the need for the fast availability of spare parts and local technical support, and I am confident that they can deliver a high level of service to our customers across the Russian Federation.”

Of the appointment, Matthew Elvin, CEO, Snorkel said, “I would like to take this opportunity to thank Arslift for their business to date, and welcome them to the Snorkel family. Russia is an important market as well a large geographical territory that requires a distribution partner with a branch network that can service customers in all areas. I believe that Arslift truly have this capability and look forward to working more closely with them in their new capacity as an official Snorkel distributor.”

For more information on Arslift, please visit www.arslift.ru.

8632.post_title: Five Lithium-Powered Snorkel Rough Terrain Scissor Lifts Enter Full Production
8632.post_content:
Snorkel is very pleased to announce that it has commenced full production on five lithium-ion battery powered compact rough terrain scissor lift models.

Now in production in Snorkel’s assembly facilities in the U.K. and New Zealand, the five new ‘RTE’ electric rough terrain scissor lifts expand Snorkel’s lithium-powered range of zero emission rough terrain aerial lifts and telehandlers to a total of eight models. They join the Snorkel SL26RTE and SL30RTE electric Speed Level’s launched in 2019, and the Snorkel SR5719E/SR626E electric compact rough terrain telehandler launched in 2020.

Available for delivery globally, the range includes lithium-ion battery versions of two narrow width units, the S2255RTE and S2755RTE, as well as three standard width units, the S2770RTE, S3370RTE and S3970RTE. These scissor lifts are designed to offer a true zero emission rough terrain solution, without compromising on the reliability and four-wheel drive capabilities of the diesel equivalents.

The five new scissor lifts are equipped with maintenance-free lithium-ion battery packs with built-in battery management systems (BMS), which last up to twenty-times longer than lead acid batteries. Suitable for most environments, the lithium-ion battery packs have been tested in climatic chambers between -77°F (-25°C) and +140°F (+60°C). These Snorkel models are offered as standard with two 5.75kWh lithium battery packs, and can be optioned with an additional 5.75kWh battery pack for extended range for very heavy use applications or where long-distance driving is required.

In both test conditions and real-life applications, the standard two battery pack system has been proven to deliver at least an eight-hour shift on a single charge, and in some cases, up to one week between charges, subject to usage. Unlike lead acid batteries, the charging pattern for lithium-ion batteries is designed to seamlessly fit into a normal working day schedule and can be top-up charged during breaks and shift changes.

Designed for outdoor applications, a powerful and efficient AC electric motor creates efficiencies in the hydraulic drive system with higher torque than a diesel engine, which in turn provides improved gradeability and enhanced performance on rough terrain than traditional combustion scissor lifts.

The electric motor also delivers up to 62% less jobsite noise than the diesel equivalent, enabling the lifts to be used indoors or in work environments with noise regulations, and with no engine fan, dust generation is reduced for safer and cleaner operation in low emission zones and green cities. With minimal battery and electrical system maintenance required, servicing costs are reduced by up to 93% when compared to an engine, while also eliminating the costs and risks of waste oil and filter disposal.

Matthew Elvin, CEO, Snorkel, said, “We are delighted to extend our proven lithium-ion battery solution to these five popular compact rough terrain scissor lift models. Within the past two years, we have developed and fully released eight electric zero emission models with four-wheel drive capabilities, with more to come. We understand that our customers need robust, reliable and easily adopted products that help them achieve their net zero goals without compromising on performance, and are proud to offer these innovative lifts which deliver on all fronts.”

The Snorkel S2255RTE and S2755RTE can reach maximum working heights of 27 ft. 10 in (8.5m) and 33 ft. 1 in. (10.1m) and offer lifting capacities of 925 lbs. (420kg) and 660 lbs. (300kg) respectively. Popular for their narrow width of just 4 ft. 9 in (1.45m), these lifts feature a spacious 4 ft. 7 in. x 12 ft. 8 in. (1.4m x 3.93m) platform with the 3 ft. 11 in. (1.2m) roll-out deck extension deployed. Weighing less than 6,062 lbs. (2,750kg), these lifts can be towed by a car or light commercial vehicle on a trailer between jobs.

Measuring 5 ft. 10 in (1.8m) wide, the S2770RTE can lift up to 1,250 lbs. (580kg) to a maximum working height of 33 ft. (10.1m), while the S3370RTE can lift 1,000 lbs. (454kg) to a working height of up to 39 ft. (12m). Reaching up to 45 ft. (13.8m), the S3970RTE is the largest compact rough terrain scissor lift in the family and is capable of lifting up to 771 lbs. (350kg).

All five lifts are available with high grip, non-marking tires for indoor/outdoor use, and have powerful four-wheel drive capabilities with 35% gradeability and an oscillating axle. Four auto-leveling stabilizers come as standard, which benefit from Snorkel’s inverted leg design that protects the cylinder rod from damage and debris, and can level up to 6 degrees front-to-rear, and 10 degrees side-to-side.

These same models also continue to be offered as ‘RT’ versions with a diesel engine or as ‘BE’ versions with Snorkel’s innovative bi-energy solution that enables the operator to switch between an internal combustion engine and lead acid battery power for indoor/outdoor working.

All five ‘RTE’ models are now in full production with initial customer deliveries underway. For more information on availability and ordering, interested parties can contact their local Snorkel sales representative or dealer.

8639.post_content:
Snorkel is very pleased to announce that Boels-Cramo Group have invested in 354 Snorkel TM12 telescopic mast lifts for their rental fleets across Europe and Scandinavia.

The deal, which was negotiated by Snorkel’s Andrew Fishburn from a distance during the pandemic through a series of virtual meetings, product evaluations and research by the Boels-Cramo team, was completed in March and deliveries from Snorkel’s facility in the U.K. have now commenced.

The 354 units, which are custom-painted in Boels orange, were ultimately chosen for their outdoor-rating and the robust dual-coat custom-colour powder paint finish offered by Snorkel. They are being delivered rental-ready into Finland, Norway, Sweden, Estonia, and the Netherlands.

The TM12 was the original self-propelled telescopic mast lift introduced in the early 1990s, and remains a market-leading product today. Delivering a maximum working height of 5.6m, the Snorkel TM12 can lift a platform capacity of 227kg, yet weighs just 830kg. Measuring 0.76m wide, the compact Snorkel TM12 can easily pass through standard doorways and be carried in passenger elevators. A 0.5m roll-out extension deck and non-marking tyres come as standard.

The Boels-Cramo Group is one of the leading equipment rental solutions providers in Europe, with 750 depots in 18 countries, employing a total of 7,500 people.

Of the decision to invest in Snorkel TM12’s, Cramo Product Area Manager for Access Equipment, Jacobo Campos said, “Compact telescopic mast lifts are a very popular product type with our customers, so we took the time to evaluate the options.
