The Snorkel TM12 is the original, and with the upgrades that have been made to this design over the years, along with Snorkel’s unique dual-coat powder paint finish, we have selected a leading product for our fleet and our extensive customer base.”

Andrew Fishburn, Snorkel Vice President of Strategic Accounts – EMEA, added, “We are extremely proud to be supplying a market-leader with Snorkel TM12’s, and we thank Jacobo and the Boels-Cramo team for their consideration and the business.”

For more information on the Boels-Cramo Group, visit www.boels.nl.

8646.post_content:
Ahern Denmark™ is very pleased to announce the appointment of Lars Raagaard as Sales Manager.

Lars joins the growing team at Ahern Denmark, which acquired the major business activities of Danish distribution business, KH Lift ApS in April, and provides sales, service and spare parts for leading equipment brands including Snorkel™ and DENKA Lift.

Previously employed by Terex Corporation, Lars Raagaard became sales manager for Genie Scandinavia in 2006, and was promoted to Sales Director in 2016, where he was responsible for sales in Germany, Austria and Switzerland. In 2017, Lars also became Sales Director for Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Finland, Greenland, Faroe Islands, Iceland and the Baltic countries. He started his career in 1987 at Hünnebeck, part of the Harsco Corporation as a Building Engineer, before becoming a Product Manager - Work Platforms in 1992 until 1995. Since then, Lars has held a number of roles at SGB Denmark in the Scaffolding, Formwork, and Aerial Work Platforms division, including Sales Manager, Sales Director, and CEO from 2004 to 2006.

In his new role at Ahern Denmark, Lars will focus on developing sales in the Danish market for Snorkel aerial lifts, telehandlers and material lifts, as well as DENKA Lift products. Henrik Skibsted, who leads Ahern Denmark in his role as Managing Director will retain territory sales management for Scandinavia and The Baltics on behalf of Snorkel.

Henrik Skibsted said, “We are delighted to welcome Lars on-board at Ahern Denmark. Having spent more than 25 years in the aerial work platform industry, Lars is widely known and very well respected, and brings significant experience, customer focus and strategic vision to our expanding team. Our goal is to become a leading provider of aerial equipment in Denmark, and I know that Lars is the right person to help us achieve this.”

Of joining Ahern Denmark, Lars said, “I am excited to start a new chapter with Henrik and the team, as this new business journey begins. While I have always enjoyed travelling and meeting people across the region and beyond, I am looking forward to doing more of that in my home country of Denmark in this new role. The Snorkel brand, and particularly some its key products, are already popular in Denmark, but I look forward to introducing customers to the wider product range, including the new lithium-ion battery powered models.”

Lars commences his new role with immediate effect. Ahern Denmark A/S, which was announced on 1st April 2021 is nearing the completion of its transition from KH Lift ApS, and will shortly be launching its new website.

The company is also continuing to recruit for a number of newly-created roles. Interested parties can find details at www.aherndenmark.dk or contact Henrik Skibsted at +45 50 53 85 22 or e-mail henrik.skibsted@aherndenmark.dk.

8659.post_title: Acces Industrie Grow Rental Fleet With Snorkel
8659.post_content:
French lifting equipment specialist Acces Industrie is expanding its rental fleet with 327 Snorkel™ mobile elevating work platforms.

The order, which was received in two parts in early 2021, consists of 245 electric slab scissor lifts, a mix of Snorkel S3215E, S3219E, S3226E and S4732E models, plus 70 Snorkel S3010P push-around mini scissor lifts, and 12 Snorkel A38E electric articulated boom lifts.

The lifts, which are mostly being delivered in Acces Industrie’s distinctive blue paint scheme are being deployed in their rental fleet across their network of more than 37 branches. All units are being assembled at Snorkel’s manufacturing facility in the U.K. and benefit from dual-coat powder paint. The order was placed with Romain Muller, Snorkel territory manager for France, Benelux, Switzerland and North Africa.

Headquartered in Tonneins, France, Acces Industrie operates a rental fleet of more than 8,600 units, specializing in mobile elevating work platforms, telehandlers, and industrial fork trucks. With nearly 25 years’ experience in lifting equipment rental, Acces Industrie became the official dealer for Snorkel in France in 2016, as well as for other leading lifting equipment brands, and has since expanded its range to target the industrial market and long-term rentals.

Through both organic growth and acquisitions, most recently Novelis in the Pays de la Loire region, Acces Industrie is continuing to expand its rental presence across France, and grow its fleet accordingly.

Pascal Meynard, Chief Executive Officer of Acces Industrie said, “Despite the challenges of 2020, Acces Industrie remains committed to our long-term growth plan. This latest investment in Snorkel lifts helps us to expand our access equipment fleet to meet the needs of our growing branch network and customer base. We chose Snorkel as we trust the build quality and know that the products can withstand the demands of the rental industry, while featuring a robust custom paint finish that looks good in our fleet for many years.”

Matthew Elvin, CEO, Xtreme Manufacturing & Snorkel, said, “I would like to thank Pascal and Acces Industrie for this significant order, as they continue to invest in Snorkel products. We are delighted to be part of their growth, and are confident that these machines will provide many years of service.”

For more information on Acces Industrie, please visit www.acces-industrie.com.

8666.post_title: Snorkel UK Appoints Business Development Manager
8666.post_content:
Snorkel UK, the official distributor for Snorkel™ and Ruthmann Bluelift in the U.K. is very pleased to announce the expansion of its sales team.

Long-time equipment industry professional, Scott McCall, joined Snorkel UK on 6th April 2020 as its new Business Development Manager, reporting to Andrew Fishburn, Managing Director. Scott also becomes the companies’ first Net Zero Specialist, tasked with introducing U.K. customers to new lithium-ion powered equipment, and helping them to market these zero emission solutions to their customers.

Scott McCall is widely known in the equipment sector having started his career in sales and marketing at Nationwide Platforms in 1997. He then spent time as a U.K. National Sales Manager for Gardener Denver from 2006 to 2008, before moving to Altec where he led their sales expansion into Russia, CIS and Baltic States until 2011. Drawing upon his industry background, Scott has been operating his own businesses during the past ten years, including consulting in sales, marketing and distribution for multiple leading brands, including IronPlanet®, Oil&Steel, Socage, and France Elevateur.

Working for Snorkel UK, Scott will have day-to-day responsibility for developing sales in the North West region of the U.K., while also working nationwide with key accounts as they work towards achieveing their Net Zero and sustainability goals with low and zero emission equipment.

Andrew Fishburn, Managing Director at Snorkel UK and Vice President, Strategic Accounts – EMEA for Snorkel, said, “We are delighted to have Scott join our team. He is very well-known and well-respected in the wider equipment sector having had many years of experience in the heavy lifting, crane, MEWP and off-road vehicle markets, here in the UK, and also across EMEA, Russia and the CIS countries.”

“I am confident that Scott can both develop his regional territory in the North West of England, while also bringing his valuable real-world sales and marketing expertise to our key account customers who are in the early stages of adopting zero emission and low emission equipment.”

Scott officially joined Snorkel UK on Tuesday, 6th April and spent his first few days at Snorkel UK’s headquarters and Snorkel assembly facility in Washington, Tyne & Wear meeting the team and participating in product training.

Of his new role, Scott said, “I am really excited to be joining Snorkel UK. I’m looking forward to getting on the road and meeting many new and existing contacts in the North West, as well as starting to work with the key accounts. Snorkel’s range of lithium products are truly industry-leading, yet benefit from a simplicity of design that will be appreciated by hire companies and their customers. It’s also a great feeling to be promoting British-built equipment, and working with such a highly motivated and positive team.”

8673.post_title: Hi-Reach Appointed As New Snorkel Distributor For South Africa
8673.post_content:
Snorkel™, a leading global manufacturer of mobile elevating work platforms is pleased to announce the appointment of Hi-Reach Manlift (Pty) Limited as its official distributor for South Africa.

Headquartered in Springs, South Africa in the Gauteng province, approximately 50km (31 miles) east of Johannesburg, Hi-Reach was previously the official distributor for Genie. Hi-Reach CEO, George Landsberg has been involved with mobile elevating work platforms for more than 23 years, and in 1999 founded Johnson Access, before opening Hi-Reach in 2005. He is involved with various industry bodies, including previously holding the position of Vice President at the Institute for Work at Height (IWH), President of the Contractors Plant Hire Association (CPHA) and Chairman of the SABS Technical Committee TC214.

With two branch locations, Hi-Reach offers a full range of MEWP products and services, including new and used equipment, spare parts, product support, financing, equipment rebuilds, inspections and training. As the official Snorkel distributor, they will have access to the entire Snorkel product range, including scissor lifts, boom lifts, mast lifts, material lifts and telehandlers.

Hi-Reach operate from a new facility in Apex Industrial, Benoni where they took delivery of their first stock of Snorkel lifts in April 2021. They have been providing parts, service and repairs, as well as training services from their Springs and Alrode locations in Gauteng since early 2021.

Regarding the appointment, Snorkel CEO, Matthew Elvin, said, “We are delighted to welcome Hi-Reach Manlift to the Snorkel family. Hi-Reach is a well-established company with significant experience and tenure in the industry, and I am confident that this will be a strong and successful partnership.”

George Landsberg, CEO at Hi-Reach said, “Snorkel provides the ideal wide-spectrum of MEWPs and telescopic handlers for our market, and as they have already sold a number of machines into Southern Africa over the last twenty years or so, it is not an unfamiliar brand. The cultural fit with Snorkel also made the decision relatively easy for us.”

Michael Wright, Director at Snorkel Middle East, added, “South Africa is a growing market with significant potential for all types of aerial lifts and material handling equipment. George and the Hi-Reach team are incredibly well-regarded and I know that they are the right partner to bring our innovative full-line product offering to this territory, backed by excellent local service and support.”

For more information on Hi-Reach Manlift, please visit www.hi-reach.co.za.

8679.post_title: Snorkel Expands ‘Kickstart’ Finance Program In Europe
8679.post_content:
Following initial success in the U.K., Snorkel is pleased to announce that it has expanded its ‘Kickstart’ finance program to customers in France and Poland.

Designed to help businesses affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, the Kickstart program helps customers to get the equipment they need today, while maximizing cashflow in the short to mid-term, as the economy restarts.

The finance programs, which are available until 2nd July 2021, are provided by Snorkel Finance™, and are available to qualifying customers in France and Poland. They are available on all Snorkel products, including aerial lifts, material lifts and telehandlers.

Barry Nicholson of Snorkel Finance, said, “This is a challenging time for our customers, many of whom were not prepared for the longevity of business interruption caused by the ongoing pandemic. We have specifically designed this program to help our customers continue to meet their customers’ needs while ensuring conservation of cashflow in the short to mid-term, while we work to overcome the pandemic and return to some business normality.”

The details of the finance programs and how to apply can be found here. Finance is subject to status, and subject to change without notice.

8685.post_title: An Electric Snorkel Investment For Naboen
8685.post_content:
Norwegian rental company, Naboen AS, recently took delivery of two Snorkel SR626E fully electric compact rough terrain telehandlers, as part of a larger order for 147 electric Snorkel lifts.

The order, which was received in early 2021, includes two lithium-ion battery powered SR626E compact telehandlers, plus a mix of 145 Snorkel TM12 self-propelled telescopic mast lifts, S3219E electric slab scissor lifts, and S3006P push-around mini scissor lifts.

The Snorkel SR626E is the world’s first fully electric compact rough terrain telehandler. Powered by long-lasting, maintenance-free lithium-ion batteries, the Snorkel SR626E is completely zero emissions, yet delivers the same lifting capacity and four-wheel drive capabilities as its diesel powered equivalent. Capable of lifting up to 2,600kg, the SR626E reaches a maximum lifting height of up to 5.79m, and with its compact dimensions and high-grip, non-marking tyres can easily navigate confined spaces both inside and out.

Celebrating 25 years in business in 2021, Naboen AS was founded in Stavanger, Norway in 1996. Through strategic planning and the development of a strong corporate culture, Naboen has developed an impressive presence as a leading general rental equipment provider in the Norwegian market with nine branches. In 2012, Naboen AS was named European small/medium-sized rental company of the year, and in 2018, they were named the European large rental company of the year.

With a focus on sustainability, Naboen has ISO 14001 certification, and operates a mostly electric rental fleet, with continuing focus on investing in ‘green’ and zero emission products to replace those traditionally powered by fossil fuels and combustion engines.

Of their decision to invest in electric Snorkel lifts, Jone Ølberg, Business Development & Fleet Management at Naboen, said, “While it has been possible to purchase small electric mobile elevating work platforms for many years, we were very interested to see the launch of the first fully electric telehandler and took the opportunity to become one of the first rental companies to offer these units to our customers. Often used in confined spaces, the zero emissions, lower noise and zero dust generation of the Snorkel SR626E will certainly be appreciated on many jobsites, in addition to the environmental benefits.”

Matthew Elvin, CEO, Xtreme Manufacturing & Snorkel, said, “It is great to see Naboen investing in electric telehandlers, and we thank them for this most recent order. Naboen are one of the leaders in terms of their environmental commitments and we are very pleased to be able to play our part by supplying electric alternatives to traditional diesel products, which still deliver the performance their customers expect.”

This order was placed with Henrik Skibsted, Territory Manager for Scandinavia and The Baltics for Snorkel, and has been immediately deployed into their rental fleet upon delivery.

For more information on Naboen AS, please visit www.naboen.no.

8697.post_title: Ahern International Expands With Danish Acquisition
8697.post_content:
Ahern International, the global distribution network owned by Don F. Ahern, is pleased to announce its expansion into Denmark with the acquisition of KH Lift ApS.

In a deal completed earlier today, the distribution division acquired the major business activities of well-established Danish distribution business, KH Lift ApS, owned by Karsten Haahr. A new entity, Ahern Denmark A/S, has been established and will take over the ongoing equipment sales, service and spare parts business with immediate effect, for leading brands including Snorkel™. The existing KH Lift team will transition to Ahern Denmark and will operate from the current KH Lift facility in Vejle, Denmark.

Karsten Haahr, founder and long-term owner of KH Lift ApS, will continue to operate the business with a focus on the sale of used equipment, as well as sales of new Instant scaffolding and Sumner material lifts, from its new headquarters in Lunderskov, Denmark.

Ahern Denmark A/S, led by Henrik Skibsted, will commence the take-over of the existing business operations immediately, and plans to officially launch on 1st May 2021. Henrik is currently the territory manager for Snorkel for Scandinavia and The Baltics, and will retain those responsibilities whilst also leading the Ahern Denmark business.

Matthew Elvin, CEO, Xtreme Manufacturing & Snorkel, and with responsibility for the Ahern International distribution network, said, “We are very pleased to be acquiring KH Lift ApS who have been a high performing independent distributor for Snorkel for many years. It gives us great pleasure to be able to support Karsten with the next step in his journey, as well as bring a motivated and experienced team on board who have had great success in the Danish market to date.”

“I wish Karsten the very best for the future, and look forward to building upon the solid foundations that are already in place.”

Karsten Haahr, added, “I am very grateful to Don, Matthew, Henrik and the Ahern International business for this opportunity and I am confident that they are the right choice to continue and expand our existing operations in Denmark. I wish them much success.”

Ahern Denmark is currently recruiting for a number of newly-created roles in preparation for the official launch in May. Interested parties can find details at www.aherndenmark.dk or contact Henrik Skibsted at +45 50 53 85 22 or e-mail henrik.skibsted@aherndenmark.dk.

8703.post_title: Snorkel Europe Achieves ISO 14001 & ISO 50001 Certification
8703.post_content:
At its manufacturing facility in the U.K., Snorkel Europe Limited is proud to announce that it has achieved two new ISO certifications.

The company, which has held ISO 9001 certification for Quality Management Systems for 16 years, achieved ISO 14001 Environmental Management & ISO 50001 Energy Management in 2020. Designed as frameworks which drive continuous improvement, ISO 14001 and ISO 50001 help companies to minimize their impact on the environment, conserve resources and ensure environmental regulation compliance, while ultimately improving the bottom line through the elimination of waste.

The scope of the ISO certification currently relates to all actions carried out on the Snorkel manufacturing site in Washington, Tyne and Wear, but the company plans to expand this scope to include the supply chain once all on-site improvements have been completed. An onsite employee Energy & Environment committee involving team members from all departments supported the ISO certification process, and are leading the company to meet its 2021 goal of a 5% energy usage and waste reduction at the plant.

John Gill, Chief Manufacturing Officer at Snorkel, said, “I am incredibly proud of the efforts of the team at Snorkel Europe in achieving ISO 14001 and 50001 certifications. It is a journey that we are taking together, and it is really rewarding to see the continued improvements across the business that come as a result of the many small steps we take each day in reducing waste.”

“The changes that we have made as part of this process range from large investments, such as new energy efficient lighting in the factory and the development of lithium-ion battery powered equipment, to improved waste segregation.”

For more information on sustainability at Snorkel, visit https://www.snorkellifts.com/About-Us#sustainability.

8709.post_title: Snorkel S3019e Wins Prestigious Iapa Award
8709.post_content:
Snorkel is very proud to announce that its S3019E electric scissor lift has been named the Product of the Year – Scissor Lifts and Vertical Mast Platforms in the annual International Awards for Powered Access (IAPAs).

Jointly organized by Access International and IPAF, the IAPAs celebrate excellence in the powered access industry. Originally planned to take place as an in-person event in London in April 2020, the IAPA’s were postponed as a result of the covid-19 pandemic, and took place virtually March 18th, 2021.

The virtual award ceremony and IPAF summit was watched by more than 1,000 industry professionals from more than 70 countries, who saw 12 IAPA award winners announced. The Snorkel S3019E was named the winner of the Product of the Year – Scissor Lifts and Vertical Mast Platforms, in a highly competitive category with six shortlisted entries.

Snorkel CEO, Matthew Elvin accepted the award on behalf of the company. The panel of judges chose the Snorkel S3019E as the winner of this category in appreciation of its sunken scissor stack, which delivers a lower stowed height, which leads to greater safety margins, safer loading and unloading, towing and entry and exit of the platform.

For more information on the IAPA’s, please visit www.iapa-summit.info. The 2022 event is scheduled to take place in London, England as an in person event.

8715.post_title: JOFEMESA Reaches Higher With Thirty Snorkel Lifts
8715.post_content:
Spanish machinery rental company, JOFEMESA, has expanded its mobile elevating work platform fleet with the additional of thirty mid-size Snorkel lifts from Ahern Iberica.

One of the leading rental companies in Spain, JOFEMESA operates a fleet of more than 4,000 units, including more than 1,300 MEWPs. Founded in 1987, JOFEMESA has a strong presence in the south east of Spain, with branches in Madrid, Valencia, Alicante, Castellón, Asturias and Málaga.

As part of continued investment, JOFEMESA recently took delivery of thirty mid-size Snorkel scissor lifts and boom lifts. The order, handed over by Ahern Iberica Managing Director, Enrique Garcia, included eight S3370RT and eight S3970RT compact rough terrain scissor lifts; eight A46JRT and three A62JRT diesel rough terrain articulated boom lifts; and three A38E electric articulated boom lifts.

“We are very pleased to expand our fleet with this latest delivery of Snorkel lifts,” said JOFEMESA CEO, Joaquín Fernández. “It has been great to work on this order with Enrique and the Ahern Iberica team. Our businesses share similar values and both have an unwavering commitment to customer support in our DNA.” 

Enrique Garcia, added, “JOFEMESA is a leading name in the Spanish rental industry, and we are really proud to be chosen as the supplier for this latest fleet investment. I appreciate the trust that Joaquín has placed in myself and Ahern Iberica, and we look forward to working together in future.”

For more information on JOFEMESA, please visit www.jofemesa.com.

8721.post_content:
Banner Plant is continuing to grow its fleet with more Snorkel scissor lifts.

Four bi-energy compact rough terrain scissor lifts, built in the UK, were recently delivered to Banner Plant’s Rotherham depot. Snorkel UK’s Area Sales Manager, Jon Plaskitt handed over two Snorkel S3370BE and two Snorkel S3970BE scissor lifts to Banner Plant depot manager, Phil James, and provided familiarization training.

Available on all Snorkel narrow and compact rough terrain scissor lifts, Snorkel’s innovative bi-energy power solution delivers the ultimate in jobsite and hire flexibility. The lift can be operated using its powerful combustion engine for outdoor activities, or be easily switched to DC battery power for quiet, zero emission electric performance for use indoors or in low emission zones. The lifts come equipped as standard with high grip, non-marking tyres to perform in all environments.

The Snorkel S3370BE reaches a maximum working height of 12m and can lift a maximum capacity of up to 450kg. The larger S3970BE can lift a platform capacity of 350kg to a maximum working height of up to 13.8m. Both scissor lifts measure 1.8m wide, and come with a 1.2m roll-out deck extension to maximize the working area, and have impressive four-wheel drive capabilities. Four hydraulic outriggers with automatic levelling come as standard, and benefit from Snorkel’s innovative outrigger leg design, where the cylinder is inverted to protect the rod from damage when extended.

Of the recent delivery, Phil James said, “The bi-energy power solution from Snorkel is a great option as it can be used in many more applications than a standard diesel compact rough terrain scissor lift, ultimately increasing utilization opportunities.”

“This can either mean that a construction customer may keep the lift on hire for longer, using it on the jobsite from start to finish – on outdoors tasks initially, and then indoors for the final fit-out stages, or it could mean that we benefit from additional hire possibilities, such as in sensitive environments or low emission zones where the use of a combustion engine may be prohibited.”

Banner Plant operates hire centres in Dronfield, Chesterfield, Derby, Leeds, Leicester, Rotherham and Ossett, and is headquartered in Dronfield on the outskirts of Sheffield. They offer a wide range of products and services for hire and sale, including plant, powered access, big air, power tools, accommodation and serviced toilets.

Gary Crofts, Sales & Operations Director at Banner Plant added, “Compact rough terrain scissor lifts are a popular choice for our hire customers, but we take pride in offering other variants, such as these bi-energy models, which can increase productivity or versatility in certain applications. These lifts are in addition to our already extensive fleet offering of low emission solutions that are available to our customers.”

The four bi-energy scissor lifts were built at Snorkel’s manufacturing facility in North East England, and feature Snorkel’s dual-coat powder paint finish and are backed by a two-year parts and labour and five-year structural warranty as standard.

“Once again, we thank Banner Plant for their continued investment in Snorkel lifts.” said Andrew Fishburn, managing director of Snorkel UK. “These bi-energy compact rough terrain scissor lifts are really an excellent choice for hire companies, and help to meet increasing emissions and noise regulations in certain areas and applications. Special thanks to Phil, Gary and the team. We’re sure the bi-energy models will be a big hit at the Rotherham branch.”

For more information on Banner Plant, please visit www.bannerplant.co.uk.

8728.post_title: First Snorkel Scissors For FTH Hire
8728.post_content:
FTH Hire Group have made their first investment in Snorkel™ lifts, with their recent order of ten Snorkel scissors.

The mixed delivery included two Snorkel S3219E, four S3226E and two S4732E electric scissor lifts, plus two Snorkel S3370RT compact rough terrain scissor lifts. Delivered in mid-February to the Farnham depot, Snorkel UK Area Sales Manager, Scott Holtby handed over the lifts and provided machine familiarization training to the FTH Hire team.

FTH Hire group is a family-owned business, with more than 40 years’ experience in supplying local contractors, builders, landscapers, and craftsmen, as well as the general public, with plant and tool hire services. They operate a fleet of more than 4,000 items, including drills, sanders, cement mixers and mowers, to larger plant, including excavators, dump trucks, track chippers, as well as boom and scissor lifts.

Headquartered in Farnborough, FTH Hire has six hire hubs located across Surrey, Hampshire, Berkshire and Kent serving the southeast counties of the UK.

“We are committed to supplying quality equipment,” said Peter Marsh, Director at FTH Hire Group. “We are constantly replacing our fleet to ensure that our customers are hiring the latest equipment, which is modern, efficient and reliable.”

 

“To meet growing demand for lifting equipment, we are very pleased to expand our fleet of scissor lifts with this recent delivery, and to take the first step with Snorkel. We were impressed by the robust build quality of the Snorkel products, the excellent paint finish which will keep the lifts looking fresher for longer, and the fact that they are assembled right here in the UK.”

Andrew Fishburn, Managing Director, Snorkel UK, added, “FTH Hire manage a large and varied fleet of equipment, so it is important to them that the equipment they purchase is very reliable and robust. We are delighted that FTH Hire chose to award Snorkel with this order, and thank them for the trust placed in our products and our team. We are confident that these scissor lifts will exceed their expectations, and we hope to become a valued long-term partner.”

 

For more information on FTH Hire Group, please visit www.fthhiregroup.co.uk.
